scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and ironic tone of Austen's opening, with natural French phrasing. However, 'quartier' (neighborhood/district) is slightly less precise than the original's social connotation, and the translation loses some of the original's rhythmic emphasis on 'universally acknowledged' by rendering it more straightforwardly.

results.translated_text: Le studio était imprégné d'un parfum riche de roses, et lorsque la légère brise estivale soufflait à travers les arbres du jardin, elle apportait avec elle l'odeur intense du lilas, ou le parfum plus délicat des rosiers à fleurs roses. De l'angle du canapé persan en cuir sur lequel il était allongé, tout en fumant, comme il le faisait souvent, une multitude de cigarettes, Lord Henry Wotton pouvait apercevoir le reflet doré et doux des fleurs de laburnum.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness and aesthetic quality of Wilde's prose, with natural French phrasing. However, some nuances are lost: 'saddle-bags' becomes 'cuir' (leather), 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' is simplified to 'doré et doux' (golden and sweet), and 'just catch the gleam' becomes 'pouvait apercevoir le reflet' (could see the reflection), losing the delicate immediacy of the original.

results.translated_text: « Vous avez été en Afghanistan, je suppose. » « Comment diable en savez-vous ? », demandai-je, stupéfait. « Peu importe », répondit-il, en souriant. « La question est maintenant celle de l'hémoglobine. Vous voyez sans doute l'importance de ma découverte ? » « C'est intéressant, d'un point de vue chimique, sans doute », répondis-je, « mais en pratique… » « Eh bien, monsieur, c'est la découverte la plus pratique et pertinente du point de vue médico-légal depuis des années. Ne voyez-vous pas que cela nous donne un test infaillible pour les traces sanguines ? »

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and dialogue flow of the original, with natural French phrasing. Minor issues include 'en souriant' (smiling) instead of 'chuckling to himself' which slightly softens Holmes's tone, and 'la découverte la plus pratique et pertinente' adds redundancy not present in the original.

results.translated_text: Je suis allé dans les bois parce que je souhaitais vivre de manière délibérée, pour faire face aux réalités essentielles de la vie et découvrir ce que je pouvais en apprendre, et non, à mon décès, constater que j'avais vécu une vie ordinaire. Je ne voulais pas vivre une vie qui n'était pas une vie, car vivre est précieux ; ni ne voulais-je pratiquer le résentiment, sauf lorsqu'il était absolument nécessaire. Je voulais vivre pleinement et profiter de chaque instant.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning but contains significant errors: 'resignation' is mistranslated as 'résentiment' (resentment), and the final phrase 'suck out all the marrow of life' becomes the generic 'profiter de chaque instant' (enjoy each moment), losing Thoreau's visceral intensity. The philosophical tone is somewhat diluted, though the opening remains reasonably faithful.

results.translated_text: Appelez-moi Ishmael. Il y a quelques années – je ne sais pas exactement combien – et sans avoir beaucoup d'argent, ni d'intérêt particulier sur terre, j'ai décidé de partir en mer pour un petit voyage et observer le monde marin. C'est une façon pour moi de me vider et de réguler mes humeurs. Chaque fois que je ressens une amertume ou un découragement, chaque fois que novembre est une saison humide et pluvieuse dans mon âme, je sais qu'il est temps de partir en mer dès que possible.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic narrative meaning but loses significant nuances and archaic tone. Key issues include: 'je ne sais pas exactement' (I don't know exactly) misrepresents the original's dismissive 'never mind'; 'me vider' (empty myself) poorly conveys 'driving off the spleen'; and the poetic melancholy of 'grim about the mouth' and the soul metaphor are flattened. The archaic, meditative voice of Melville is replaced with more modern, straightforward French.

results.translated_text: Es ist eine allgemein anerkannte Wahrheit, dass ein lediger Mann, der über ein gutes Vermögen verfügt, eine Frau braucht. Unabhängig davon, wie wenig über die Gefühle oder Ansichten eines solchen Mannes die Nachbarn wissen, ist diese Wahrheit so fest im Bewusstsein der umliegenden Familien verankert, dass er als das rechtmäßige Eigentum einer ihrer Töchter gilt.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the core meaning and captures Austen's ironic tone about marriage expectations, though 'braucht' (needs) is slightly less elegant than the original's 'must be in want of.' The phrasing is generally natural but occasionally reads more formally constructed than the original's flowing prose.

results.translated_text: Das Studio roch nach Rosen, und als der leichte Sommerwind durch die Bäume im Garten wehte, drang der intensive Duft der Lilien oder der zartere Duft der Rosenbüsche durch die offene Tür. Von der Ecke des Divans aus Perser-Saddlebags, auf dem er lag und rauchte – wie es seine Gewohnheit war – unzählige Zigaretten, konnte Lord Henry Wotton gerade noch den Glanz der süßen, honigfarbenen Blüten eines Laburnum wahrnehmen.

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but loses significant sensory richness and aesthetic precision. Key issues: 'Rosen' lacks the evocative 'rich odour' quality, 'Lilien' misidentifies lilac (Flieder), 'Rosenbüsche' incorrectly translates 'pink-flowering thorn', and 'Perser-Saddlebags' is awkwardly literal. The sentence structure becomes clunky and disrupts Wilde's flowing, sensuous prose style.

results.translated_text: "Sie waren in Afghanistan, das sehe ich", sagte er. "Wie haben Sie das denn herausgefunden?" Ich fragte erstaunt. "Ach, was soll's", sagte er und kicherte. "Die Frage ist jetzt, was die Entdeckung mit dem Hämoglobin zu tun hat. Sehen Sie nicht die Bedeutung dieser Entdeckung?" "Es ist interessant aus chemischer Sicht, das ist wohl klar", antwortete ich, "aber praktisch—" "Nein, mein Freund, das ist die praktischste und bedeutsamste Entdeckung im medizin-rechtlichen Bereich der letzten Jahre. Sehen Sie nicht, dass es uns einen unfehlbaren Test für Blutspuren ermöglicht?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning but contains several accuracy issues: 'Wie haben Sie das denn herausgefunden?' misattributes the question to Watson instead of Holmes, and 'was die Entdeckung mit dem Hämoglobin zu tun hat' distorts Holmes's statement about haemoglobin's significance. The style feels somewhat modern and informal ('Ach, was soll's,' 'mein Freund') compared to the Victorian-era formality of the original, and the dialogue attribution becomes confusing in places.

results.translated_text: Ich ging in den Wald, weil ich das Ziel hatte, bewusst zu leben, nur die wesentlichen Aspekte des Lebens zu betrachten und zu sehen, ob ich daraus etwas lernen konnte, anstatt erst im Sterben festzustellen, dass ich nicht gelebt hatte. Ich wollte nicht nur das Leben führen, das nicht Leben ist, denn das Leben ist so kostbar; und ich wollte nur dann resignieren, wenn es unbedingt notwendig war. Ich wollte tief leben und das Maximum aus dem Leben herausholen.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning but loses some philosophical precision and poetic force. Key issues: 'das Ziel hatte' is awkward for 'wished'; 'Aspekte' weakens 'essential facts'; 'das Maximum aus dem Leben herausholen' is colloquial where Thoreau's 'suck out all the marrow' is visceral and metaphorical; the rhythm and cadence of the original's philosophical meditation are diminished.

results.translated_text: Nennen Sie mich Ishmael. Vor einigen Jahren – es ist mir egal, wie genau – hatte ich wenig Geld in meiner Tasche und keine besonderen Interessen am Land. Ich beschloss, ein wenig zu segeln und die Welt zu erkunden. Das ist eine Methode, um mich zu entspannen und meinen Kreislauf in Ordnung zu bringen. Wenn ich das Gefühl habe, dass meine Stimmung düster wird, oder wenn es ein feuchtes, tristes Novemberwetter in meinem Inneren ist, weiß ich, dass es höchste Zeit ist, so schnell wie möglich aufs Meer zu segeln.

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but loses significant nuance and archaic tone. Key issues include 'es ist mir egal' (I don't care) misrepresenting the original's casual aside, 'die Welt zu erkunden' (explore the world) oversimplifying 'see the watery part of the world,' and modernized phrasing that strips away Melville's 19th-century literary voice and philosophical depth.

results.translated_text: Es un hecho universalmente reconocido que un hombre soltero con una buena fortuna, debe estar en busca de una esposa. Sin importar cuán poco conocidos puedan ser los sentimientos o ideas de tal hombre al entrar en un nuevo vecindario, esta verdad está tan arraigada en la mente de las familias circundantes, que se considera que él pertenece a alguna de sus hijas.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures most of Austen's ironic tone, though 'debe estar en busca de' is slightly less elegant than the original's imperative construction, and the final clause loses some of the sardonic edge of 'rightful property' by using 'pertenece a' instead of a more pointed phrasing.

results.translated_text: El estudio estaba impregnado del rico aroma de las rosas, y cuando la suave brisa estival agitaba los árboles del jardín, el fragante perfume del lilas o el más delicado aroma de las espinas rosadas entraban a través de la puerta abierta. Desde la esquina del sofá de cuero de estilo persa en el que estaba sentado, fumando, como era su costumbre, innumerables cigarrillos, Lord Henry Wotton apenas podía percibir el brillo de las flores de laburnum, de un color dorado y dulce.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meanings accurately but loses some aesthetic precision: 'saddle-bags' becomes 'cuero de estilo persa' (Persian-style leather), and 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' is simplified to 'dorado y dulce' (golden and sweet), diminishing Wilde's sensory layering. The prose reads naturally in Spanish but lacks the rhythmic elegance and synaesthetic richness of the original.

results.translated_text: "Supongo que usted ha estado en Afganistán", dije con asombro. "¿Cómo es que lo sabía?" pregunté. "No importa", dijo, riendo para sí mismo. "La cuestión ahora es sobre el hemoglobina. Sin duda, usted comprende la importancia de este descubrimiento mío". "Es interesante, desde un punto de vista químico, sin duda", respondí, "pero en la práctica—" "¡Pero, hombre, es el descubrimiento médico-legal más práctico de los últimos años! ¿No lo ve? ¿Nos da una prueba infalible de manchas de sangre?"

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant structural errors: the first line incorrectly attributes Holmes's observation to Watson, and dialogue attribution is confused throughout, disrupting the original's narrative flow. While most vocabulary is accurate, the awkward phrasing and incorrect speaker assignments substantially undermine both meaning preservation and the natural dialogue rhythm characteristic of Doyle's style.

results.translated_text: Fui al bosque porque deseaba vivir de forma intencional, enfrentándome solo a los hechos esenciales de la vida, y ver si podía aprender lo que tenía que enseñar. No quería vivir una vida que no fuera vida, porque la vida es un tesoro; ni tampoco quería practicar la resignación, a menos que fuera estrictamente necesaria. Quería vivir profundamente y extraer todo lo valioso de la vida.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning accurately, though some philosophical nuances are lost—notably 'suck out all the marrow' becomes the more generic 'extract all that is valuable,' diminishing the visceral intensity. The fluency is strong and reads naturally in Spanish, but the elevated, deliberate philosophical tone of the original is somewhat softened in places.

results.translated_text: Llámame Ishmael. Hace algunos años – no importa cuánto tiempo exactamente –, sin dinero en el bolsillo y sin nada en particular que me interesara en tierra, decidí zarpar y ver el mundo acuático. Es una forma de liberar tensiones y regular mi estado de ánimo. Cada vez que me siento melancólico y de mal humor; cada vez que es un día húmedo y lluvioso en mi interior, considero que es el momento perfecto para zarpar en cuanto pueda.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core narrative meaning accurately but loses significant archaic literary flavor and philosophical depth. Key issues: 'driving off the spleen' becomes generic 'liberar tensiones' (missing the 18th-century medical/psychological reference), 'regulating the circulation' is simplified to 'regular mi estado de ánimo,' and the poetic introspection of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' becomes more literal and less evocative. The archaic tone and Melville's distinctive voic

results.translated_text: È un fatto universalmente riconosciuto che un uomo single, in possesso di una buona fortuna, deve necessariamente cercare una moglie. Indipendentemente da quanto poco conosciuti possano essere i sentimenti o le opinioni di tale uomo al momento del suo arrivo in un nuovo quartiere, questa verità è così radicata nella mente delle famiglie circostanti, che egli viene considerato come un potenziale pretendente per una delle loro figlie.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning accurately but loses some of Austen's ironic bite. The use of 'single' (English loanword) instead of 'celibe' and 'potenziale pretendente' instead of 'proprietà legittima' weakens the satirical edge of the original's absurdist humor about women as property.

results.translated_text: Lo studio era inebriato dal profumo intenso dei rose, e quando la leggera brezza estiva soffiava tra gli alberi del giardino, l'odore intenso del glicine o il profumo più delicato dei cespugli di rosa si diffondeva attraverso la porta aperta. Dal angolo del divano in pelle persiana su cui era seduto, fumando, come faceva spesso, un numero infinito di sigarette, Lord Henry Wotton riusciva a scorgere il luccichio dolce e dorato dei fiori di un laburnum.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the sensory richness but contains notable errors: 'rose' should be 'rose' (plural), 'glicine' (wisteria) misidentifies 'lilac' (lilla), and 'pelle persiana' (Persian leather) misinterprets 'saddle-bags.' The phrase 'inebriato dal profumo' (intoxicated by scent) is creative but shifts Wilde's more restrained aesthetic tone; 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' loses its poetic parallel structure when rendered as 'dolce e dorato.'

results.translated_text:
"Capisco che sei stato in Afghanistan", dissi con stupore. "Come fai a saperlo?"
"Non importa", rispose, ridendo tra sé e sé. "La questione è invece riguardo all'emoglobina. Immagino che tu comprenda l'importanza di questa mia scoperta?"
"È interessante, dal punto di vista chimico, senza dubbio", risposi, "ma dal punto di vista pratico—"
"Ma, amico, è la scoperta medico-legale più pratica degli ultimi anni. Non lo vedi?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant errors: the dialogue attribution is reversed in the opening (Holmes's line is attributed to Watson), and the final question loses the specific reference to 'infallible test for blood stains.' While generally fluent, these accuracy issues and the loss of Holmes's characteristic precision undermine the translation's quality.

results.translated_text: Sono andato nel bosco perché desideravo vivere in modo autentico, concentrandomi solo sugli aspetti essenziali della vita e cercando di capire cosa potesse insegnarmi, piuttosto che scoprire, quando sarei morto, di non aver vissuto veramente. Non volevo vivere una vita superficiale, perché la vita è così preziosa; né volevo accettare passivamente le cose, a meno che non fosse assolutamente necessario. Volevo vivere a fondo, assaporando ogni momento e trarre il massimo da ogni esperienza.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core philosophical meaning but loses some of Thoreau's distinctive metaphorical language, particularly the vivid 'suck out all the marrow of life' which becomes the more generic 'assaporando ogni momento e trarre il massimo da ogni esperienza.' The Italian reads naturally and the existential intent is preserved, though the poetic intensity and deliberate repetition of the original are somewhat diminished.

results.translated_text: Chiamatemi Ishmael. Alcuni anni fa – non importa esattamente quanti – trovandomi in una situazione di povertà, senza denaro e senza particolari interessi sulla terraferma, decisi di salpare e di esplorare il mondo marino. È un modo per alleviare la tensione e regolare il mio stato d'animo. Ogni volta che mi sento triste e depresso; ogni volta che il novembre è umido e piovoso nel mio animo, ritengo che sia il momento giusto per salpare il prima possibile.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning but loses significant nuance and archaic tone. Key issues include: 'trovandomi in una situazione di povertà' is overly explicit compared to the understated 'having little or no money'; 'spleen' (melancholy/depression as a humoral concept) becomes generic 'tensione'; 'regulating the circulation' is simplified to 'stato d'animo'; and the poetic 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' becomes literal 'novembre è umido e piovoso nel mio animo.' results.translated_text: É um facto universalmente reconhecido que um homem solteiro, em posição de fortuna, deve necessariamente ter uma esposa. Embora os sentimentos ou opiniões desse homem possam ser desconhecidos para as famílias vizinhas, a verdade é tão bem estabelecida na mente dessas famílias que ele é considerado como um possível pretendente para alguma de suas filhas.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning accurately but loses some of Austen's biting irony and satirical edge. 'Possível pretendente' (possible suitor) weakens the original's claim that he is 'rightful property,' and the phrasing is slightly more literal than Austen's elegant irony demands.

results.translated_text: O estúdio estava repleto do aroma rico das rosas, e quando a leve brisa da tarde soprava entre as árvores do jardim, o perfume intenso do lílio ou o aroma mais delicado da roseira florida em rosa entravam pela porta aberta. Do canto do sofá de couro persa em que estava deitado, fumando, como era seu costume, inúmeras cigaretas, Lord Henry Wotton conseguia apenas vislumbrar o brilho dos flores doces e douradas do laburnum.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning but contains several issues: 'saddle-bags' is mistranslated as 'couro persa' (Persian leather), the phrase 'pink-flowering thorn' becomes 'roseira florida em rosa' (pink-flowering rosebush) losing botanical precision, and 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' is simplified to 'doces e douradas' missing the poetic repetition. The prose reads somewhat awkwardly with grammatical inconsistencies ('flores doces' should be 'flores doces e douradas'), diminishing

results.translated_text: "Você esteve no Afeganistão, imagino." "Como você sabia disso?", perguntei, surpreso. "Não importa", respondeu ele, rindo sozinho. "A questão agora é sobre a hemoglobina. Não duvido que você perceba a importância da minha descoberta?" "É interessante, do ponto de vista químico, sem dúvida", respondi, "mas na prática—" "Veja bem, é a descoberta mais prática e relevante para a área médica e jurídica nos últimos anos. Você não vê que isso nos dá um teste infalível para manchas de sangue?"

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately, though 'imagino' is slightly weaker than 'perceive' and some phrasing is expanded unnecessarily. The dialogue flows naturally in Portuguese but loses some of the original's crisp Victorian formality and Holmes's characteristic terseness, particularly in the final exchange where the translation becomes more verbose than the source.

results.translated_text: Eu fui para a floresta porque desejava viver de forma intencional, confrontando apenas os aspectos essenciais da vida e tentando descobrir o que ela tinha a me ensinar, e não, quando chegasse ao fim, descobrir que não havia realmente vivido. Não desejava viver uma vida que não fosse a vida, pois a vida é tão valiosa; nem desejava praticar a resignação, a menos que fosse absolutamente necessária. Queria viver profundamente e aproveitar ao máximo cada momento.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and philosophical intent well, with natural Portuguese phrasing. However, it loses some of Thoreau's poetic intensity—notably 'suck out all the marrow of life' becomes the weaker 'aproveitar ao máximo cada momento,' and 'living is so dear' shifts from existential weight to mere value, diminishing the original's philosophical precision and lyrical power.

results.translated_text: Me chame de Ishmael. Há alguns anos—não importa exatamente quantos—eu estava com pouco ou nenhum dinheiro no bolso e sem nada de particular para me interessar na terra firme, então decidi zarpar e explorar o mundo aquático. É uma forma de aliviar o estresse e regular a circulação. Sempre que me sentia deprimido e sombrio; sempre que o novembro era úmido e chuvoso em minha alma, eu sabia que era hora de partir para o mar o mais rápido possível.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic narrative meaning but loses significant nuance and archaic tone. Key issues include 'Me chame' (informal) instead of 'Chamem-me' (formal), 'aliviar o estresse' (modern) instead of period-appropriate phrasing, and 'deprimido e sombrio' which misses the subtle melancholy of 'growing grim.' The opening's iconic simplicity and the philosophical introspection of the original are diminished.

results.translated_text: Jest to prawda powszechnie uznawana, że mężczyzna w posiadaniu znacznego majątku musi być w potrzebie żony. Niezależnie od tego, jak mało znane mogą być uczucia lub poglądy takiego mężczyzny, kiedy wkracza do nowego otoczenia, ta prawda jest tak głęboko zakorzeniona w umysłach okolicznych rodzin, że on jest uważany za potencjalnego małżonka jednej z ich córek.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the ironic tone of Austen's opening, though 'potencjalnego małżonka' (potential husband) slightly softens the original's sharper 'rightful property' metaphor, and the prose flows naturally in Polish with only minor stylistic adjustments.

results.translated_text: Studio wypełniał bogaty zapach róż, a gdy słoneczny wiatr delikatnie wiał wśród drzew w ogrodzie, przez otwarte drzwi do środka docierał intensywny zapach lilii lub subtelniejszy zapach róż. Z rogu sof, pokrytej perskimi poduszkami, na której siedział, paląc bez przerwy niezliczone papierosy, Lord Henry Wotton, mógł dostrzec błysk słonecznych, miodowych kwiatów laburnum.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general sensory atmosphere but contains notable errors: 'lilii' (lilies) misrepresents 'lilac' (bez), 'róż' (roses) repeats the opening word instead of conveying the distinct pink-flowering thorn, and 'siedział' (sat) contradicts the original 'lying.' The aesthetic precision and layered sensory details characteristic of Wilde's prose are diminished, and the fluid, luxurious rhythm of the original is disrupted by awkward phrasing and grammatical issues.

results.translated_text:
"Wiem, że byłeś w Afganistanie," powiedziałem z niedowierzaniem. "Jak to możliwe, że o tym wiesz?"
"Nie obchodzi mnie to," odparł, śmiejąc się do siebie. "Teraz najważniejsze jest pytanie o hemoglobinę. Pewnie zauważasz znaczenie mojego odkrycia?"
"Jest to interesujące, z punktu widzenia chemii," odpowiedziałem, "ale praktycznie—"
"No, panie, to jest najbardziej praktyczne odkrycie medyczne-prawnie od lat. Czy to nie jest oczywiste, że daje nam niezawodny test na obecność krwi?"

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant errors: the speaker attribution is reversed (Watson should ask the question, Holmes should answer), dialogue is misattributed throughout, and key phrases like 'haemoglobin' become 'hemoglobinę' (accusative case, incorrect here). The style loses Holmes's characteristic deductive confidence and Watson's astonishment, reading awkwardly with grammatical issues ('medyczne-prawnie' is clumsy for 'medyczno-sądowe').

results.translated_text: Pojechałem do lasu, ponieważ chciałem żyć w sposób świadomy, aby skonfrontować się tylko z podstawowymi prawdami życia i sprawdzić, czy mogę się czegoś nauczyć, a nie, kiedy będę umierać, odkryć, że nie żyłem prawdziwego życia. Nie chciałem żyć w sposób, który nie jest prawdziwym życiem, ponieważ życie jest tak cenne; ani nie chciałem uczyć się rezygnacji, chyba że będzie to absolutnie konieczne. Chciałem żyć głęboko i w pełni wykorzystać każdą okazję.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent, though some nuances are lost or altered. The final phrase 'w pełni wykorzystać każdą okazję' (fully utilize every opportunity) significantly deviates from the original's vivid 'suck out all the marrow of life,' weakening the metaphorical intensity. The prose reads naturally in Polish but lacks some of the original's rhythmic and stylistic power.

results.translated_text: Zadzwoń do mnie, Ishmael. Kilka lat temu – nie ważne, ile dokładnie, – miałem niewiele pieniędzy w portfelu i nic konkretnego, co mnie interesowało na lądzie. Postanowiłem więc popłynąć i zobaczyć, jak wygląda świat z morza. To sposób, w jaki radzę sobie ze swoim zniecierpliwieniem i reguluję krążenie krwi. Kiedy tylko czuję, że staje się mi przygnębienie i listopad mnie w duszy; wtedy wiem, że muszę jak najszybciej popłynąć na morze.

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant errors: 'Call me' is incorrectly rendered as 'Zadzwoń do mnie' (imperative 'call me' rather than the narrative 'I am called'), and 'driving off the spleen' becomes 'radzę sobie ze swoim zniecierpliwieniem' (coping with impatience), losing the archaic medical/philosophical meaning. The archaic, meditative tone of the original is replaced with more colloquial modern Polish, and several phrases are awkwardly constructed or semantically inaccurate.

results.translated_text: 这在任何社会都已被公认的事实是：单身且拥有良好经济状况的男子，必然需要一位妻子。无论这位男子初入社区时，其个人感受或观点如何，这种普遍认知都已深深植根于周围家庭的思想中，因此，他被视为某个家庭女儿的合法归属。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses Austen's signature ironic tone and elegant simplicity. The phrasing is somewhat awkward and overly formal, failing to convey the witty, sardonic voice that defines the original opening. Key ironic elements are diluted through literal translation rather than stylistic adaptation.

results.translated_text: 工作室弥漫着玫瑰的芬芳，当夏日微风在花园的树木间吹拂时，打开的门也带入了浓郁的紫罗兰香味，或者娇艳的蔷薇花香。从他躺在扶手椅上，抽着无数根烟的角落，洛伦·沃顿能瞥见到，在花园的角落里，金灿灿、蜂蜜色的荚蒾花。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general sensory atmosphere but contains significant errors: 'divan of Persian saddle-bags' is mistranslated as 'armchair,' 'lilac' becomes 'violet,' 'pink-flowering thorn' becomes 'rose,' and 'laburnum' is incorrectly identified as 'viburnum.' These botanical inaccuracies undermine the aesthetic precision central to Wilde's prose, and the flowery, rhythmic quality of the original is diminished.

results.translated_text: “你之前去过阿富汗，我能感觉到。”我惊讶地问道。 “这怎么可能？” “没关系，”他说，自言自语地笑了，“现在的问题是关于血红蛋白。你一定能理解我这项发现的重要性。” “从化学角度来说，这确实很有趣，”我回答，“但从实际应用来说……” “实际上，这是近年来最具有实际意义的医学和法律发现。你明白吗？这让我们能够进行一个绝对可靠的血迹检测。”

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately, though there are some structural issues: the dialogue attribution is confused in the opening (mixing speaker perspectives), and 'chuckling to himself' becomes 'laughing to himself' which slightly alters the tone. The scientific terminology is handled well, but the conversational flow and Holmes's characteristic deductive confidence are somewhat diminished in the Chinese version.

results.translated_text: 我进入森林，是因为我希望能够真实地生活，只面对人生的基本要素，并看看我是否能够从中学习，而不是在生命即将终结时才发现自己并没有真正地活过。我并不希望追求虚假的、不真实的生活，因为“生活是如此宝贵”，我也并不希望采取消极的态度，除非是绝对必要的。我希望能够深入地生活，并尽可能地体验人生的全部。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core philosophical meaning and intent well, though some nuances are lost or slightly altered (e.g., 'front' becomes 'face' conceptually, 'suck out all the marrow' becomes more abstract 'experience fully'). The fluency is natural in Chinese but occasionally adds interpretive phrases that weren't in the original, and the poetic intensity of Thoreau's deliberate repetition and rhythm is somewhat diminished in the target language.

results.translated_text: 请叫我伊士梅尔。大约十年前，我手无寸金，也没有什么特别的事情可做，于是我决定去海边航行，看看这个水世界的景象。这对我来说是一种缓解压力和调节身体的方式。每当我感到心情低落，或者在阴雨的十一月里，我都会立刻决定尽快去海边。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic narrative meaning but loses significant nuances: 'driving off the spleen' becomes generic '缓解压力' (stress relief), 'regulating the circulation' is oversimplified, and the temporal ambiguity of 'never mind how long precisely' is replaced with a specific '十年前' (ten years ago). The archaic, philosophical tone of the original is substantially diminished, replaced with more modern, colloquial phrasing that doesn't match Melville's contemplative voice.

results.translated_text: 這是一個普遍被認可的事實：一個擁有財富的單身男子，必然會渴望迎娶一位妻子。無論這個男子初入社區時，其個人情感或觀念如何，這個事實都已深深紮根於周圍家庭的意識中。因此，他被視為其中某位女兒的合法配偶。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning accurately but loses some of Austen's distinctive ironic tone and the elegant flow of her opening. The phrase '必然會渴望迎娶一位妻子' is somewhat literal and misses the ironic understatement of the original, and '合法配偶' (legal spouse) doesn't fully convey the satirical 'rightful property' concept.

results.translated_text: 工作室里弥漫着浓郁的玫瑰花香，当夏日微风吹拂花园里的树木时，通过敞开的门，可以闻到紫罗兰或粉色花朵的清香。从他躺在铺着波斯风格沙发的沙发的角落里，吸着他习惯性的无数支烟，这位名叫沃顿的男爵，可以勉强捕捉到一种蜂蜜般的、金色的杜鹃花。

scores.feedback: The translation loses significant sensory precision and aesthetic nuance: 'lilac' is mistranslated as 'violet' (紫罗兰), 'pink-flowering thorn' becomes generic 'pink flowers', and 'laburnum' is incorrectly rendered as 'azalea' (杜鹃花). The prose is awkward with redundancy ('沙发的沙发' - sofa of sofa) and fails to capture Wilde's lyrical, flowing aesthetic style, reading more like a functional description than literary prose.

results.translated_text:
“你之前去过阿富汗，我明白了。”我惊讶地问道。
“这怎么可能？”我自言自语道。
“没关系，”他说，一边自嘲地笑了。
“现在的问题是关于血红蛋白。你一定看到了我这项发现的意义吧？”
“从化学角度来说，这确实很有趣，”我回答，“但从实际应用来说——”
“实际上，这可是几年来最实用的医学和法律发现。你明白吗？”

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant structural errors: the dialogue attribution is confused (Holmes's first line is attributed to Watson, and Watson's response is misattributed), disrupting the conversation flow and character identification. While individual phrases are reasonably translated, these attribution errors fundamentally compromise accuracy and the detective's distinctive analytical tone is somewhat diluted.

results.translated_text: 我前往森林，是因为我希望过上真正有意义的生活，直面人生的基本事实，并看看我是否能从中学习到什么，而不是等到生命的终点才发现自己并没有真正地活过。我不想追求虚假的、不真实的生命，因为生命是如此宝贵；我也不想轻易放弃，除非情况确实需要。我希望能够深入体验生活，尽可能地从生活中汲取养分。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical essence and meaning of Thoreau's passage well, with faithful rendering of key concepts like deliberate living and extracting life's marrow. Minor deviations include slightly simplified phrasing in places (e.g., '真正有意義的生活' for 'live deliberately') and a somewhat more explanatory tone than Thoreau's original, which slightly softens the aphoristic intensity of the source text.

results.translated_text: 請叫我伊士梅爾。幾年前——具體時間不重要——我手無寸金，且在陸地上沒有任何特別的興趣，我決定出海一趟，看看這個水域的世界。這是我舒緩心情、調節氣血的方式。每當我感到心情低落，或者在心裡感到陰雨綿綿的十一月的陰鬱時，我總會立刻計畫出海。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic narrative meaning but loses significant nuance and archaic tone. Key issues include: 'spleen' rendered as '心情低落' (low mood) rather than preserving the medical-philosophical concept; 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' becomes overly literal and loses poetic resonance; the opening 'Call me Ishmael' becomes 'Please call me' which softens the imperative authority. The fluency is somewhat stiff, and the archaic literary style of the original is not adequately refle

results.translated_text: 普遍的に受け入れられている真実として、財産のある独身男性は、必ず結婚を望んでいる。たとえ、そのような男性が初めて近隣にやってきたとき、彼の感情や考えが全く知られていなくても、周辺の家族の間では、この真実は深く根付いているため、彼が誰かの娘の「正当な所有物」であると認識されている。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone well, accurately conveying Austen's satirical commentary on marriage expectations. However, the phrasing is somewhat formal and stilted in places, and the ironic bite of 'rightful property' could be softened slightly to better match the original's subtle mockery.

results.translated_text: スタジオにはバラの芳醇な香りが漂い、庭の木々を吹き抜ける穏やかな風が、オープンしたドアからラベンダーやバラの花の繊細な香りを運んでくる。ペルシャ絨毯のような革張りのソファに横たわり、タバコをくゆらせる様子は、いつも通りだった。そこから、蜂蜜のような甘い色合いのラベンダーの花々がかすかに見えた。

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant accuracy errors: 'lilac' is mistranslated as 'ラベンダー' (lavender), 'laburnum' is also incorrectly rendered as lavender, and 'Persian saddle-bags' becomes 'Persian carpet-like leather sofa,' losing the original's specific aesthetic detail. The sensory-rich aestheticism of Wilde's prose is diminished, and the flowing, interconnected imagery is fragmented into simpler sentences.

results.translated_text:
「あなたはアフガニスタンに行ったことがあるのですね」と、驚きながら尋ねた。
「一体どういうことだ？」
彼は笑いながら答えた。「さて、今度はヘモグロビンについてです。私のこの発見の重要性をご存知でしょう？」
「化学的には興味深いものですが、実用的には…」と、私は答えた。
「いえ、これは長年で最も重要な医療・法医学的な発見です。血痕を特定するための完璧な方法だと、ご存知ですか？」

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant structural errors: the first line incorrectly attributes Holmes's observation to the narrator, and dialogue attribution is confused throughout. While vocabulary choices are generally appropriate, the natural flow and Victorian-era formality of the original are diminished, and some nuances (like Holmes's characteristic deduction method and Watson's skepticism) are not clearly conveyed.

results.translated_text: 私は森へ行ったのは、生き方を深く追求し、人生の本質を見つめ、本当に生きているのか確かめるためでした。単に生きているだけではなく、人生そのものを体験したいと思いました。また、必要な時以外は諦めない生き方を心がけたいと考えていました。つまり、人生のあらゆる側面を深く味わい、その価値を最大限に引き出すことが私の目的でした。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general philosophical intent but loses key nuances: 'deliberately' becomes vague 'deep pursuit,' 'front only the essential facts' is omitted entirely, and the powerful 'suck out all the marrow' is softened to 'fully draw out value.' The fluency is natural Japanese, but the style lacks Thoreau's direct, aphoristic intensity and his characteristic paradoxes.

results.translated_text: 私をアイズメルと呼びなさい。数年前、正確にはどのくらいの期間かは覚えていないが、お金も、陸上での興味深いものもほとんど持たずに、私は海を少しだけ冒険し、世界の水辺を見てみたいと考えた。これは、私の気分を落ち着かせ、体内の循環を整えるための方法だ。いつも、口元が険しいと感じたり、心の奥底で雨が降っているような気分になったりすると、できるだけ早く海に出る必要があると判断する。

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but loses significant nuance and literary quality. Key issues include: 'Call me Ishmael' rendered as imperative rather than the original's intimate directness; metaphorical language like 'spleen' and 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' flattened into literal descriptions; archaic tone replaced with modern Japanese; and awkward phrasing ('口元が険しい' misses the melancholic tone). The translation reads more like a straightforward narrative than Melville's poetic,

results.translated_text: 모든 사람이 공감하는 사실은, 재산이 있는 한 남자라면 반드시 배우를 원한다는 것입니다. 아무리 잘 알려지지 않은 그의 감정이나 생각이라도, 이웃 지역에 처음 나타난다고 해서, 주변의 가족들은 그를 다른 딸 중 누구의 소유로 간주합니다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses Austen's iconic irony and satirical tone. The phrase '모든 사람이 공감하는 사실은' (a fact everyone sympathizes with) weakens the universal declaration, and the sentence structure becomes awkward and fragmented, particularly in the second sentence where the logical flow breaks down. The distinctive voice and wit of the original are significantly diminished.

results.translated_text: 스튜디오는 장미의 향기로 가득했고, 여름의 부드러운 바람이 정원의 나무 사이를 스치며, 개방된 문을 통해 라일락의 짙은 향기나, 또는 분홍 꽃을 가진 덤불의 섬세한 향기가 들어왔습니다. 페르시아 직물로 만든 소파 위에 누워, 담배를 피우는 그의 평소 습관대로, 런드 헨리 와튼은 모서리에서, 달콤하고 황금빛 꽃인 율브룸 나무의 향기를 희미하게 느낄 수 있었습니다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses significant sensory precision and aesthetic refinement. Key issues include awkward phrasing ('런드 헨리 와튼' for Lord Henry), mistranslation of 'laburnum' as '향기' (scent) instead of the flower itself, and clumsy sentence structure that disrupts Wilde's flowing, ornate prose style.

results.translated_text: “당신은 아프가니스탄에 갔었군요.” “어떻게 아셨어요?” 저는 놀라며 물었습니다. “아, 됐어요. 이제는 헤모글로빈에 대해 이야기해야겠네요. 당신도 제가 이 발견의 중요성을 깨달았을 거라고 생각하죠?” “화학적으로는 흥미롭겠지요,” 저는 대답했습니다. “하지만 실용적인 측면에서는…” “아, 이건 지난 몇 년 동안 가장 실용적인 의학 법적 발견 중 하나입니다. 당신도 혈흔을 검사하는 확실한 방법을 제공한다는 것을 이해하고 있겠죠?”

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and dialogue structure but has notable issues: awkward phrasing in places ("아, 됐어요" doesn't match Holmes's casual dismissal), some grammatical awkwardness ("당신도 제가 이 발견의 중요성을 깨달았을 거라고 생각하죠?" is convoluted), and the translation loses Holmes's characteristic sharp, confident tone, making him sound more uncertain and verbose than the original.

results.translated_text: 저는 숲으로 갔습니다. 제 목적은 의도적으로 삶을 살고, 삶의 본질적인 측면만을 경험하며, 삶이 가르쳐줄 수 있는 것을 배우고 싶었기 때문입니다. 죽기 전에 삶을 제대로 살지 못했다는 것을 깨닫지 않기를 바랐습니다. 저는 삶의 소중함을 알고, 꼭 필요한 경우가 아니면 절망을 선택하지 않기를 원했습니다. 저는 삶을 깊이 살고, 삶의 모든 가치를 누리기 원했습니다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning but loses key nuances: 'front only the essential facts' becomes vague, 'living is so dear' is misinterpreted as 'knowing the preciousness of life,' and 'suck out all the marrow' is weakened to 'enjoy all the value.' The philosophical intensity and Thoreau's distinctive voice are diminished, though the Korean prose remains readable.

results.translated_text: 제 이름은 이스메일입니다. 몇 년 전 – 정확히 몇 년인지 중요하지 않지만 – 돈이 거의 없고, 육지에서 특별히 흥미로운 일이 없었기에, 저는 잠시 배를 타고 바다를 여행하며 세상을 구경하고 싶었습니다. 이것은 저에게 스트레스를 해소하고 혈액 순환을 원활하게 하는 방법입니다. 언제나 입가에 굳은 표정을 띠거나, 눅눅하고 비가 내리는 11월의 기분이 들 때, 저는 가능한 한 빨리 바다로 떠나는 것이 좋다고 생각합니다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but loses the archaic tone and poetic quality of Melville's prose, using modern colloquialisms like '스트레스' (stress) instead of preserving the period voice. The phrasing feels stilted and overly literal, failing to convey the philosophical melancholy and rhythmic elegance of the original opening.

results.translated_text: Đây là một chân lý mà mọi người đều đồng ý, rằng một người đàn ông độc thân có một gia sản đáng kể, chắc chắn sẽ phải tìm kiếm một người vợ. Dù cảm xúc hoặc ý kiến của người đàn ông này có ít người biết đến khi bước chân vào một khu phố mới, chân lý này vẫn được mọi người trong khu phố nhận thức rõ, vì vậy họ coi anh ấy là người chồng phù hợp cho một trong các cô con gái của họ.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses Austen's signature ironic tone and the elegant paradox of the opening. The phrasing is somewhat awkward ('chân lý mà mọi người đều đồng ý' is clunky) and 'người chồng phù hợp' misses the satirical implication that daughters are property rather than the man being property of the families.

results.translated_text: Phòng tràn ngập hương thơm nồng nàn của hoa hồng, và khi làn gió mùa hè nhẹ nhàng thổi qua những cây trong khu vườn, mùi hương đậm đà của hoa huệ tây, hoặc hương thơm tinh tế hơn của hoa hồng leo, cũng len lỏi vào qua cánh cửa mở. Từ góc cạnh của chiếc ghế sofa kiểu Persan, nơi ông đang nằm và hút thuốc, như thói quen của mình, vô vàn điếu thuốc, Lord Henry Wotton có thể thoáng thấy ánh sáng lấp lánh của những bông hoa laburnum, với sắc hương ngọt ngào và màu vàng.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning and sensory details, but contains some botanical inaccuracies (hoa huệ tây for lilac, hoa hồng leo for pink-flowering thorn) and awkward phrasing that disrupts the aesthetic flow. The lyrical, flowing quality of Wilde's prose is diminished by structural choices and less elegant word choices.

results.translated_text:
"Tôi biết anh đã từng ở Afghanistan," tôi nói, ngạc nhiên. "Vậy, anh biết được điều đó bằng cách nào vậy?"
"Không sao cả," anh cười, "Bây giờ, chúng ta cần nói về hemoglobin. Anh có nhận thấy tầm quan trọng của phát hiện này không?"
"Nó thú vị về mặt hóa học, chắc chắn," tôi trả lời, "nhưng về mặt thực tế—"
"Thực ra, đây là một phát hiện y tế và pháp lý vô cùng quan trọng trong nhiều năm. Anh có thấy điều đó không?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant errors: the first line incorrectly reverses who is speaking (Watson should be astonished, not the narrator stating it), and 'infallible test' is weakened to 'vô cùng quan trọng' (extremely important). The dialogue attribution and some nuances are lost, affecting both accuracy and the distinctive Victorian detective-story tone.

results.translated_text: Tôi đến khu rừng vì tôi muốn sống một cuộc sống đích thực, đối diện với những sự thật cơ bản của cuộc sống, và xem liệu tôi có thể học được điều gì từ đó, thay vì khi sắp chết, phát hiện ra rằng mình đã không sống trọn vẹn. Tôi không muốn sống một cuộc sống không có ý nghĩa, vì cuộc sống là vô giá; cũng như tôi không muốn chấp nhận sự bất lực trừ khi thật sự cần thiết. Tôi muốn sống một cuộc sống sâu sắc và tận hưởng trọn vẹn mọi điều tốt đẹp của cuộc sống.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent, though some nuances are lost or altered. 'Sống một cuộc sống đích thực' (live a true life) weakens the deliberate intentionality of 'live deliberately,' and 'tận hưởng trọn vẹn mọi điều tốt đẹp' (fully enjoy all beautiful things) softens the visceral intensity of 'suck out all the marrow of life.' The prose reads naturally in Vietnamese but lacks some of the original's austere, contemplative tone.

results.translated_text: Xin gọi tôi là Ishmael. Cách đây vài năm—thật ra, tôi không nhớ chính xác là bao lâu—tôi không có nhiều tiền trong ví và không có điều gì đặc biệt để làm trên bờ, nên tôi quyết định đi biển một lúc để khám phá thế giới. Đây là một cách để tôi giải tỏa căng thẳng và cải thiện sức khỏe. Mỗi khi tôi cảm thấy buồn bã hoặc ủ rũ, mỗi khi trời trở nên ẩm ướt và u ám vào tháng Mười Một, tôi biết rằng đây là lúc thích hợp để đi biển càng sớm càng tốt.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and narrative voice reasonably well, but loses some of Melville's archaic formality and philosophical nuance. Phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become 'giải tỏa căng thẳng' (relieving stress), which modernizes the tone, and the poetic metaphor of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' is somewhat flattened in the Vietnamese rendering.

results.translated_text: เป็นความจริงที่ได้รับการยอมรับอย่างกว้างขวางว่า ผู้ชายที่ร่ำรวยและมีฐานะดี จะต้องต้องการการแต่งงาน อย่างไรก็ตาม ไม่ว่าความรู้สึกหรือความคิดของเขาจะยังไม่เป็นที่รู้จักในหมู่คนในละแวกนั้นเพียงใด ความจริงนี้ก็ยังคงอยู่ในความคิดของครอบครัวต่างๆ ในบริเวณนั้น ทำให้เขามีสถานะเป็น "สินสอด" ที่เหมาะสมสำหรับลูกสาวของพวกเขา

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise effectively, though 'สินสอด' (dowry/bride price) slightly shifts the original's implication of the man as property rather than a transaction. The sentence structure is somewhat condensed, losing some of Austen's characteristic rhythmic irony and the gradual build-up of her satirical observation.

results.translated_text: สตูดิโอเต็มไปด้วยกลิ่นหอมของกุหลาบ เมื่อลมในช่วงฤดูร้อนพัดผ่านต้นไม้ในสวน กลิ่นหอมของดอกไลแลค หรือกลิ่นหอมอ่อนหวานของดอกไม้สีชมพูบนต้นกุหลาบ ก็พัดเข้ามาทางประตูที่เปิดกว้าง ลอร์ดเฮนรี วอทตัน นอนอยู่บนโซฟาสไตล์เปอร์เซีย พร้อมสูบซิการ์ตามปกติของเขา เขาสามารถมองเห็นแสงสะท้อนของดอกไม้สีเหลืองทองของต้นลาเบอร์นัมได้

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key elements and sensory details but loses some poetic nuance—'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' becomes merely 'สีเหลืองทอง' (golden yellow), flattening Wilde's aesthetic layering. The sentence structure becomes choppy and less flowing than the original's elegant prose rhythm.

"ไม่เป็นไร" เขาตอบ พร้อมกับหัวเราะเบาๆ "คำถามต่อไปคือเรื่องฮีโมโกลบิน คุณคงเห็นความสำคัญของการค้นพบของฉันใช่ไหม?"
"มันน่าสนใจในแง่ของเคมี แต่ในแง่ของการนำไปปฏิบัติจริง..." ฉันตอบ "แต่"
"คุณเข้าใจแล้วใช่ไหมว่านี่คือการค้นพบทางการแพทย์และกฎหมายที่สำคัญที่สุดในช่วงหลายปีที่ผ่านมา การทดสอบเลือดที่ไม่สามารถปฏิเสธได้"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but has significant structural issues: the dialogue attribution is confused (the first line should be Holmes speaking, not the narrator), and the flow is disrupted by awkward phrasing and incomplete sentences. The tone of Victorian-era detective fiction is lost, and some technical terms feel forced rather than naturally integrated into Thai.

results.translated_text: ผมตัดสินใจเข้าไปในป่า เพื่อใช้ชีวิตอย่างมีเจตนา, เพื่อเผชิญหน้ากับความเป็นจริงของชีวิต และเรียนรู้ว่าชีวิตสามารถสอนอะไรได้บ้าง, ไม่ใช่เมื่อใกล้สิ้นอายุขัย ผมจึงค้นพบว่าผมไม่ได้ใช้ชีวิตอย่างแท้จริง ชีวิตนั้นมีค่าอย่างยิ่ง, และผมไม่อยากยอมแพ้ เว้นแต่จำเป็นจริงๆ ผมต้องการใช้ชีวิตอย่างลึกซึ้ง และดื่มด่ำกับทุกประสบการณ์

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning but loses significant nuance and philosophical depth. The sentence structure becomes convoluted, particularly in the middle section where the logical flow of Thoreau's negations is disrupted, and key phrases like 'suck out all the marrow' are oversimplified to 'ดื่มด่ำกับทุกประสบการณ์' (indulge in experiences), diminishing the visceral intensity of the original metaphor.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and narrative voice reasonably well, though some nuances are lost—particularly the metaphorical richness of 'spleen' and the poetic quality of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' which becomes more literal. The archaic literary tone is somewhat diminished in the Thai version, reading more contemporary than the original's 19th-century formality.

results.translated_text: यह एक सार्वभौमिक सत्य है कि यदि किसी व्यक्ति के पास अच्छी संपत्ति है, तो उसे पत्नी की आवश्यकता होती है। चाहे उस व्यक्ति के बारे में आसपास के लोगों को कितनी भी जानकारी न हो, लेकिन यह सत्य उनके दिमाग में इतना दृढ़ रूप से स्थापित है कि उन्हें यह माना जाता है कि उनके किसी एक बेटी के लिए वह संपत्ति उपयुक्त है।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses Austen's signature ironic tone and the elegant structure of the original. The second sentence becomes convoluted and unclear, failing to preserve the satirical observation about how society views eligible bachelors as property for daughters.

results.translated_text: स्टूडियो गुलाब की समृद्ध गंध से भरा हुआ था, और जब गर्मियों की हल्की हवा बगीचे की पेड़ों के बीच से चली, तो खुले दरवाजे के माध्यम से लिली या गुलाबी फूलों वालेthorn की हल्की सुगंध भी आ जाती थी। परशुराम के सोफे की कोना से, जिस पर वह धूम्रपान कर रहा था, लॉर्ड हेनरी वॉटन, अपनी आदत के अनुसार, उसे लगातार सिगरेट पी रहा था, वह लेबरनम के मीठे और पीले फूलों की चमक को देख सकता था।

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant errors including mistranslation of 'Persian saddle-bags' as 'परशुराम के सोफे' (Parshuram's sofa), awkward phrasing that disrupts the sensory flow, and loss of the aesthetic delicacy central to Wilde's prose. results.translated_text: "मुझे लगता है कि आप अफगानिस्तान में रहे हैं।" "यह कैसे पता?" मैंने आश्चर्य से पूछा। "इसमें कोई बात नहीं," उसने हँसते हुए कहा। "अब सवाल यह है कि हेमोग्लोबिन के बारे में। मुझे यकीन है कि आपको मेरे इस खोज के महत्व का पता है?" results.translated_text: मैंने जंगल में इसलिए जाने का फैसला किया क्योंकि मैं जानबूझकर जीवन जीना चाहता था, जीवन के मूलभूत पहलुओं का सामना करना चाहता था, और यह देखना चाहता था कि क्या मैं जीवन से कुछ सीख सकता हूं, और न ही यह महसूस करना चाहता था कि मरने से पहले मैंने वास्तव में जीवन नहीं जिया। मैं सिर्फ वही जीवन जीना चाहता था, जो वास्तव में जीवन है, क्योंकि जीवन बहुत कीमती है। और मैं केवल तभी हार स्वीकार करना चाहता था, जब यह बिल्कुल आवश्यक हो। मैं जीवन को गहराई से जीना और जीवन के हर पहलू का अनुभव करना चाहता था।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning but loses some philosophical precision and poetic force. Key issues: 'suck out all the marrow' becomes generic 'अनुभव करना' (experience), the paradoxical structure of 'not live what was not life' is awkwardly rendered, and the rhythmic intensity of the original is diminished by more explanatory phrasing.

results.translated_text: मुझे "ईशमेल" नाम से बुलाएँ। कुछ साल पहले—ठीक से कितनी साल पहले यह कोई बात नहीं है—मेरे पास बहुत कम पैसे थे, और मुझे तट पर कोई खास दिलचस्पी की चीज़ नहीं थी। इसलिए, मैंने सोचा कि मैं थोड़ा सा समुद्र में जाकर दुनिया को देखने जाऊंगा। यह मेरे लिए एक तरीका है अपने मन को शांत करने और रक्त संचार को सामान्य रखने का। जब भी मुझे मुंह में निराशा और चिड़चिड़ापन महसूस होता है, या जब मेरे मन में नवंबर का मौसम जैसा निराशाजनक माहौल होता है, तो मैं तुरंत समुद्र में जाने की तैयारी करता हूँ।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and narrative voice reasonably well, but loses some of Melville's philosophical nuance and archaic elegance. The prose feels more modern and explanatory than the original's contemplative, poetic tone, and phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become overly literal rather than maintaining their metaphorical weight.

results.translated_text: এটা একটি বহুলভাবে স্বীকৃত সত্য যে, যদি কোনো একজন পুরুষ পর্যাপ্ত অর্থ-সম্পদ নিয়ে কোনো এলাকায় নতুনভাবে আসেন, তবে তার অবশ্যই একজন স্ত্রী থাকা উচিত। প্রথমবার কোনো এলাকায় আসা এমন একজন পুরুষের অনুভূতি বা মতামত সম্পর্কে স্থানীয় পরিবারগুলো হয়তো তেমন কিছু জানে না, তবুও এই সত্যটি তাদের মনে এতটাই দৃঢ়ভাবে গেঁথে আছে যে, তারা মনে করে যে তাদের মেয়েদের মধ্যে কেউ একজনই এই পুরুষের উপযুক্ত জীবনসঙ্গী হতে পারে।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic intent reasonably well, but the sentence structure becomes awkward and verbose in Bengali, losing some of Austen's elegant conciseness. The phrase 'উপযুক্ত জীবনসঙ্গী' (suitable life partner) somewhat softens the original's sharper irony about women being 'property,' and the conditional phrasing 'যদি...তবে' alters the declarative certainty of the original opening.

results.translated_text: स्टूडियोটি গোলাপের সুগন্ধ দিয়ে পরিপূর্ণ ছিল, এবং যখন গ্রীষ্মের হালকা বাতাস বাগানের গাছের মধ্যে দিয়ে বয়ে যেত, তখন খোলা দরজার মাধ্যমে লিলি花的 তীব্র সুবাস অথবা গোলাপের সুগন্ধ প্রবেশ করত। পারস্যের চামড়ার তৈরি সোফার কোণা থেকে, যেখানে তিনি आराम করে ছিলেন এবং ক্রমাগত সিগারেট খাচ্ছিলেন, লর্ড হেনরি ওয়োটন ল্যাবুরনামের মিষ্টি এবং সোনালী ফুলগুলোর হালকা ঝলক দেখতে পেতেন।

scores.feedback: The translation contains critical errors including mixed scripts (Devanagari and Chinese characters), incorrect botanical terminology ('lilac' mistranslated as 'lily flower'), and loss of aesthetic nuance. The sensory richness and refined tone of Wilde's prose are severely compromised by awkward phrasing and script inconsistencies that make it nearly incomprehensible.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning but has structural issues: the dialogue attribution is confused (Watson's question appears before Holmes's statement), and 'Never mind' is weakly rendered as 'বিষয়টা তেমন গুরুত্বপূর্ণ নয়' (not important). The final sentence is awkwardly constructed with redundant phrasing ('নির্ভরযোগ্য পদ্ধতি' for 'infallible test') that loses Holmes's confident tone.

results.translated_text: আমি অরণ্যে গিয়েছিলাম, কারণ আমি ইচ্ছাকৃতভাবে জীবনযাপন করতে চেয়েছিলাম, জীবনের মৌলিক বিষয়গুলোর মুখোমুখি হতে চেয়েছিলাম, এবং দেখতে চেয়েছিলাম আমি জীবনের কাছ থেকে কী শিখতে পারি, এবং মৃত্যুর আগে জানতে না পারি যে আমি আসলে জীবনযাপন করিনি। আমি এমন জীবনযাপন করতে চাইনি যা জীবন নয়, কারণ জীবন অত্যন্ত মূল্যবান; এবং আমি শুধুমাত্র তখনই বিমুখ হতে চেয়েছিলাম, যখন এটি একেবারে প্রয়োজনীয় ছিল। আমি গভীর জীবনযাপন করতে এবং জীবনের প্রতিটি মুহূর্ত থেকে সম্পূর্ণভাবে উপকৃত হতে চেয়েছিলাম।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning but loses some philosophical precision and poetic force. The phrase 'suck out all the marrow of life' becomes 'উপকৃত হতে' (benefit from), which dilutes the visceral intensity of the original metaphor. Some constructions feel awkwardly literal rather than naturally Bengali.

results.translated_text: আমাকে আইশমেল নাম দিন। কয়েক বছর আগে—ঠিক কত বছর, সেটা এখন মনে নেই—আমার কাছে খুব সামান্য বা প্রায় কোনো টাকা ছিল না, আর আমার পক্ষে岸上 কিছুতেই মনোযোগ আকর্ষণ করা সম্ভব ছিল না। তাই আমি সমুদ্রে ঘুরে আসতে চেয়েছিলাম, পৃথিবীর জলভাগের অংশ দেখতে চেয়েছিলাম। এটা আমার মনকে শান্ত রাখার এবং শরীরের স্বাভাবিক কাজকর্মকে ঠিক রাখার একটা উপায়। যখনই আমি হতাশায় ভোগতাম, যখন আমার মন নভেম্বর মাসের স্যাঁতসেঁতে আবহাওয়ায় ডুবে থাকত, তখনই আমি দ্রুত সমুদ্রে যাত্রা করতাম।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic narrative content but contains a critical error (Chinese character '岸上' mixed into Bengali text), loses the philosophical nuance of 'spleen' and 'regulating the circulation,' and fails to preserve Melville's archaic, contemplative tone. The prose reads awkwardly and lacks the lyrical quality of the original.

results.translated_text: இது ஒரு பொதுவான உண்மை: ஒரு வசதியான, தனியாக வாழும் ஆண், நிச்சயமாக ஒரு மனைவியைத் தேடும். ஒரு ஆண் எந்தவொரு சமூகத்திலும் அறிமுகமாகும் போது, அவரது எண்ணங்கள் மற்றும் விருப்பங்கள் குறைவாகவே தெரிந்திருந்தாலும், அந்தச் சூழ்நிலையில் உள்ள குடும்பங்கள் இந்த உண்மையை நன்கு அறிந்திருக்கும். இதன் காரணமாக, அந்த ஆணின் எந்த ஒரு மகளுக்கும், அந்தச் சமூகத்தைச் சேர்ந்த மற்ற குடும்பங்களின் மகள்களுக்கும் அவர் ஒரு பொருளாகக் கருதப்படுவார்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses Austen's signature irony and satirical bite through overly literal phrasing and awkward sentence construction. The elegant paradox of the opening is flattened, and the biting social commentary becomes merely explanatory rather than witty.

results.translated_text: ஸ்டுடியோவில் ரோஜாக்களின் நறுமணம் நிறைந்து இருந்தது, மேலும் கோடையில் மெல்லிய காற்று மரங்களின் இலைகளுக்கு இடையே வீசும்போது, திறந்த கதவு வழியாக லைலாவின் கனமான நறுமணம் அல்லது இளஞ்சிவப்பு பூக்கள் நிறைந்த ரோஜாப்பூவின் மென்மையான நறுமணம் வந்தன. பெர்சியன் தாங்குகளைக் கொண்ட சோபாவின் ஒரு மூலையில், அவர் சிகரெட் பிடித்து ஓய்ந்திருந்த லார்ட் ஹென்றி வாட்டன், லார்ட்பர்ன் பூக்களின் இனிமையான மற்றும் தங்க நிறத் தோற்றத்தை அவ்வப்போது பார்ப்பார்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic sensory elements but loses the aesthetic refinement and poetic flow of Wilde's prose. Key issues include awkward phrasing ('அவ்வப்போது பார்ப்பார்' - 'occasionally would see' is clunky), mistranslation of 'pink-flowering thorn' as 'rose flowers,' and failure to preserve the luxurious, flowing cadence essential to Wilde's aestheticism.

results.translated_text:
"நீங்கள் ஆப்கானிஸ்தானுக்கு சென்றிருக்கிறீர்கள் என்று நான் நினைக்கிறேன்," என்று அவர் கூறினார்.
"நீங்கள் எப்படி அப்படி தெரிந்து கொண்டீர்கள்?" நான் ஆச்சரியத்துடன் கேட்டேன்.
"அதற்கும் மேல் எதுவும் இல்லை," என்று அவர் சிரித்துக்கொண்டே கூறினார்.
"இப்போது, ஹீமோகுளோபின் பற்றி பேசலாம். இந்த கண்டுபிடிப்பின் முக்கியத்துவத்தை நீங்கள் புரிந்துகொள்வீர்கள் என்று நான் நம்புகிறேன்?"
"இது வேதியியல் ரீதியாக சுவாரஸ்யமானது, சந்தேகமில்லை," என்று நான் பதிலளித்தேன், "ஆனால் நடைமுறையில்—"
"உண்மையில், இது பல ஆண்டுகளாக மருத்துவ மற்றும் சட்டரீதியான ரீதியாக மிகவும் பயனுள்ள கண்டுபிடிப்பாகும். இதன் மூலம், இரத்தக் கறைக்கான சரியான சோதனையை நாம் கண்டுபிடிக்க முடியும்," என்றார்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic plot points but contains significant errors: the opening attribution is reversed (should be Holmes speaking, not the narrator), 'Never mind' is mistranslated as 'அதற்கும் மேல் எதுவும் இல்லை' (nothing more than that), and 'infallible test' becomes 'சரியான சோதனை' (correct test) losing the absolute certainty. The dialogue flow is awkward and lacks the Victorian-era formality and Holmesian deductive confidence of the original.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic narrative content but loses significant nuance and archaic tone. Key issues include: misinterpretation of 'driving off the spleen' as reducing mental stress rather than melancholic temperament, oversimplification of 'watery part of the world' to 'beauty of the sea,' and awkward phrasing that obscures Melville's introspective, philosophical voice. The archaic literary style is largely flattened into modern Tamil prose.

results.translated_text: Я отправился в лес, потому что хотел жить осознанно, сталкиваясь только с основными аспектами жизни, и попытаться узнать, чему этот опыт может научить. Я не хотел, чтобы, когда пришло время умирать, я обнаружил, что прожил неполноценную жизнь. Я не хотел жить жизнью, отличной от настоящей, ведь жизнь – это бесценный дар. results.translated_text: Зовите меня Ишмаэль. Несколько лет назад – конкретное время уже не имеет значения – у меня не было денег в кармане, и ничего особенного не привлекало моего внимания на суше. Каждый раз, когда я чувствую угрюмость и тоску; каждый раз, когда на душе становится сыро и пасмурно в ноябре, я считаю, что пора как можно скорее отправиться в плавание.
