results.translated_text: "אתה בי באפגניסטן, אני מבין." "איך בכלל ידעת את זה?" שאלתי, בהלם. "לא משנה," אמר, תוך שהוא צוחק לעצמו. "השאלה עכשיו היא לגבי ההמוגלובין. אין ספק שאתה מבין את החשיבות של גילוי שלי?" "זה מעניין מבחינה כימית, אין ספק," עניתי, "אבל מבחינה מעשית—" "מה, אדוני, זה הגילוי המעשי והמשפטי ביותר בשנים האחרונות. האם אתה לא רואה שזה נותן לנו בדיקה בלתי מעורערת לכתמי דם?"

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately, though 'אתה בי באפגניסטן' should be 'אתה היית באפגניסטן' for proper past tense. Fluency is generally natural but some phrasings feel slightly formal or awkward (e.g., 'בלתי מעורערת' is archaic). The Victorian-era tone and Holmes's characteristic deductive confidence are somewhat diminished in the Hebrew rendering.

results.translated_text: הלכתי אל תוך היער כי רציתי לחיות באופן אותנטי, להתמודד עם העובדות החשובות ביותר בחיים, ולראות אם אוכל ללמוד מהן, ולא לגלות, כשאקח את נשי, שלא חיתי באמת. לא רציתי לחיות חיים שאינם חיים, כי החיים הם נדירים; ולא רציתי להתפשר, אלא אם כן זה יהיה הכרחי. רציתי לחיות באופן עמוק ולהפיק את כל מה שיש לחיות להציע.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning but contains several significant issues: 'אותנטי' (authentic) misses Thoreau's 'deliberately' (בכוונה תחשובנית would be better), 'להתמודד עם' (confront/deal with) weakens 'front,' and 'כשאקח את נשי' (when I take my breath) is an awkward mistranslation of 'when I came to die.' The phrase 'להפיק את כל מה שיש לחיות להציע' (extract all that life has to offer) loses the visceral power of 'suck out all the marrow.' While readable, the translation diminishes

results.translated_text: תקראו אותי אישמהל. לפני כמה שנים—לא משנה כמה בדיוק—כאשר לא היו לי כסף בכיס, וגם לא מצאתי דבר מעניין על החוף, חשבתי לצאת לשייט קצר ולראות את העולם הימי. זו דרך שלי כדי להרגיע את הלחץ ולשפר את זרימת הדם. בכל פעם שאני מרגיש עצב או חוסר עניין, ובמיוחד בחודשים הרטובים והמעוננים של נובמבר, אני ממהר לצאת לשייט ברגע שאפשר.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic narrative meaning but loses significant poetic nuance and philosophical depth of Melville's prose. The archaic, introspective tone is diminished through more literal and colloquial renderings, particularly in the metaphorical passages about 'spleen' and the soul's 'damp, drizzly November.'

results.translated_text: Il est généralement admis que tout homme célibataire fortuné doit être en quête d’une épouse. Bien que l’on connaisse peu ses sentiments ou ses intentions lorsqu’il s’installe dans un nouveau quartier, cette vérité est si profondément ancrée dans l’esprit des familles environnantes qu’il est considéré comme la proie légitime de l’une ou l’autre de leurs filles.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains good fluency in French, though 'la proie légitime' (legitimate prey) slightly shifts the ironic tone from 'rightful property' which better captures Austen's sardonic voice about commodification. The opening is well-rendered but loses some of the original's formal, aphoristic weight.

results.translated_text: Le studio était empli du parfum enivrant des roses, et lorsque la légère brise d’été se levait parmi les arbres du jardin, le parfum capiteux du lilas ou le parfum plus délicat des épines roses s’infiltrait par la porte ouverte. Du coin du divan recouvert de tapis persans sur lequel il était allongé, fumant, comme il en avait l’habitude, d’innombrables cigarettes, Lord Henry Wotton pouvait apercevoir le scintillement des fleurs d’un laburnum, d’une couleur miel et au parfum aussi doux que le miel.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the sensory richness and aesthetic focus of Wilde's prose with strong accuracy, though 'parfum enivrant' (intoxicating perfume) slightly shifts the original's emphasis on richness rather than intoxication. The fluency is natural and elegant, though the restructured final clause about the laburnum's honey-colored blossoms feels slightly more explanatory than Wilde's more impressionistic original phrasing.

results.translated_text: « Vous êtes allé en Afghanistan, je crois comprendre. » « Comment diable l’avez-vous deviné ? » demandai-je, stupéfait. « Peu importe », répondit-il en riant doucement. « La question est maintenant de savoir si vous comprenez l’importance de cette découverte que j’ai faite concernant l’hémoglobine. » « C’est intéressant, chimiquement, sans aucun doute », répondis-je, « mais dans la pratique… » « Mais enfin, c’est la découverte médico-légale la plus pratique de ces dernières années. Ne voyez-vous pas qu’elle nous fournit un test infaillible pour identifier les taches de sang ? »

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the dialogue's logical flow and character dynamics. Minor issues include slight restructuring of Holmes's second speech ("La question est maintenant de savoir si vous comprenez l'importance" adds interpretation not in the original) and "riant doucement" (laughing softly) versus the more precise "chuckling to himself," which slightly alters the tone of self-amusement.

results.translated_text: Je suis allé dans les bois parce que je voulais vivre une vie délibérée, ne me confronter qu'aux réalités essentielles, et voir si je pouvais en tirer des leçons, afin de ne pas découvrir, au moment de ma mort, que je n'avais pas vécu. Je ne voulais pas vivre une vie sans substance, car la vie est précieuse ; et je ne voulais pas me résigner, à moins que cela ne soit absolument nécessaire. Je voulais vivre pleinement et savourer chaque instant.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and philosophical intent well, with natural French phrasing. However, it loses some of Thoreau's distinctive intensity—'suck out all the marrow of life' becomes the softer 'savourer chaque instant,' and 'front only the essential facts' is weakened to 'ne me confronter qu'aux réalités essentielles,' diminishing the directness of the original prose.

results.translated_text: Appelez-moi Ismaël. Il y a quelques années – peu importe exactement combien – n’ayant que peu ou pas d’argent et n’ayant rien de particulier à faire à terre, j’ai décidé de prendre la mer et de découvrir le monde aquatique. C’est une façon pour moi d’éloigner la mélancolie et de réguler ma circulation sanguine. Dès que je sens que je deviens taciturne ; dès qu’il fait un novembre humide et pluvieux dans mon âme, je considère qu’il est temps de prendre la mer dès que possible.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately but loses some nuance—'driving off the spleen' becomes merely 'éloigner la mélancolie,' and 'growing grim about the mouth' is simplified to 'devenir taciturne.' While fluent and readable, the archaic literary tone and philosophical weight of the original are somewhat diminished, making it feel more modern and less contemplative than Melville's introspective voice.

results.translated_text: Es ist eine wohlbekannte Wahrheit, dass ein unverheirateter Mann, der ein beträchtliches Vermögen besitzt, zwangsläufig eine Ehefrau sucht. Auch wenn man die Gefühle und Ansichten eines solchen Mannes bei seinem ersten Erscheinen in einer Gegend nicht kennt, so ist diese Wahrheit doch so tief in den Köpfen der umgebenden Familien verankert, dass er als rechtmäßiges Eigentum einer ihrer Töchter betrachtet wird.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the core meaning but softens Austen's ironic opening by changing 'universally acknowledged' to 'wohlbekannte' (well-known), losing the satirical weight of the original. The prose flows naturally in German, though the style feels slightly more straightforward than Austen's characteristic ironic formality.

results.translated_text: Das Atelier war erfüllt vom betörenden Duft der Rosen, und wenn der leichte Sommerwind durch die Bäume des Gartens wehte, drang durch die offene Tür der schwere Duft der Fliederblüten oder das zartere Aroma der rosafarbenen Blüten des Weißdorns herein. Aus einer Ecke des Divans mit den persischen Satteltüchern, auf dem er lag und, wie es seine Gewohnheit war, unzählige Zigaretten rauchte, konnte Lord Henry Wotton gerade noch das Schimmern der honigsüßen und honigfarbenen Blüten eines Goldregens erkennen.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Wilde's sensory richness and aesthetic focus, with excellent word choices like 'betörenden Duft' and 'honigsüßen.' Minor fluency issues exist ('drang...herein' is slightly awkward, and 'Satteltücher' is less evocative than 'saddle-bags'), but the overall aesthetic tone and meaning are well-maintained.

results.translated_text: „Sie waren in Afghanistan“, stellte er fest. „Wie zum Teufel haben Sie das herausgefunden?“, fragte ich erstaunt. „Lassen Sie das“, sagte er und kicherte. „Die Frage ist jetzt: Was ist mit dem Hämoglobin? Sehen Sie nicht, welche Bedeutung diese Entdeckung von mir hat?“ „Chemisch gesehen ist es zweifellos interessant“, antwortete ich, „aber in der Praxis –“ „Nun, es ist die praktischste medizinisch-rechtliche Entdeckung seit Jahren. Sehen Sie nicht, dass sie uns einen unfehlbaren Test für Blutspuren ermöglicht?“

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Holmes's deductive confidence and Watson's astonishment. Minor issues: 'stellte er fest' is slightly less conversational than the original's direct statement, and 'kicherte' (giggled) is somewhat weaker than 'chuckling,' which better suits Holmes's character. The dialogue flows naturally in German with good pacing.

results.translated_text: Ich ging in den Wald, weil ich ein bewusstes Leben führen wollte, mich nur den wesentlichen Fakten des Lebens stellen und herausfinden wollte, ob ich nicht doch noch etwas daraus lernen könnte, und nicht erst beim Sterben feststellen wollte, dass ich nicht wirklich gelebt hatte. Ich wollte nicht ein Leben führen, das kein Leben war, denn das Leben ist kostbar; und ich wollte auch nicht Resignation üben, es sei denn, es wäre wirklich notwendig. Ich wollte tief in das Leben eintauchen und das Mark des Lebens aussaugen.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and captures the intensity of his prose, including the powerful metaphor of 'sucking the marrow of life' (Mark aussaugen). Minor fluency issues arise from slightly awkward constructions like 'mich nur den wesentlichen Fakten stellen' and the repetitive use of 'wollte,' which slightly diminishes the natural flow compared to the original's rhythmic elegance.

results.translated_text: Nennt mich Ismael. Vor einigen Jahren – wie lange genau, ist nicht wichtig – als ich kaum oder gar kein Geld in meiner Tasche hatte und nichts Besonderes an Land meine Aufmerksamkeit erregte, beschloss ich, etwas auf See herumzufahren und mir den wasserreichen Teil der Welt anzusehen. Das ist eine Art, wie ich meine Trübsal vertreibe und meine Stimmung aufhellen kann. Wann immer ich merke, dass ich mürrisch werde; wann immer in meiner Seele ein feuchter, nieselnder November herrscht, halte ich es für höchste Zeit, so bald wie möglich aufs Meer zu fahren.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and philosophical tone well, but loses some archaic weight with modernized phrasing like 'Aufmerksamkeit erregte' instead of more period-appropriate language, and 'Trübsal vertreibe' feels slightly awkward compared to the original's natural flow of 'driving off the spleen.'

results.translated_text: Es una verdad universalmente reconocida que un hombre soltero con una buena fortuna debe estar necesitado de una esposa. Por poco que se conozcan los sentimientos o las intenciones de un hombre al llegar a un barrio, esta verdad está tan arraigada en la mente de las familias vecinas, que se le considera la propiedad legítima de alguna de sus hijas.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves the meaning and captures Austen's ironic tone effectively, though 'necesitado de' is slightly less elegant than the original's 'must be in want of,' and the flow could be marginally smoother in places. Overall, this is a strong, competent translation that maintains the literary quality of the source material.

results.translated_text: El estudio estaba impregnado del intenso aroma de las rosas, y cuando la suave brisa veraniega se agitaba entre los árboles del jardín, a través de la puerta abierta llegaba el penetrante perfume de las lilas, o la fragancia más delicada de las rosas silvestres. Desde el rincón del diván, cubierto con tapices persas que hacían las veces de cojines, sobre el que yacía, fumando, como era su costumbre, innumerables cigarrillos, Lord Henry Wotton podía apenas vislumbrar el brillo de las flores de color miel y de dulce aroma de un labriego.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness but contains significant errors: 'rosas silvestres' (wild roses) misrepresents 'pink-flowering thorn,' and 'labriego' (peasant/farmhand) is a critical mistranslation of 'laburnum' (a flowering tree). The aesthetic tone is partially preserved but these errors undermine the precise botanical and sensory imagery central to Wilde's style.

results.translated_text:
—Veo que ha estado en Afganistán —dijo.
—¿Cómo diablos lo sabe? —pregunté, asombrado.
—No importa —respondió, riendo para sí. —La cuestión ahora es el tema de la hemoglobina. No cabe duda de que comprende la importancia de este descubrimiento mío, ¿verdad?
—Sí, es interesante desde el punto de vista químico, sin duda —contesté—, pero en la práctica...
—¡Pero hombre, es el descubrimiento médico-legal más práctico de los últimos años! ¿No se da cuenta de que nos proporciona una prueba infalible para detectar manchas de sangre?

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue flow with natural Spanish phrasing. Minor deviations include 'tema de la hemoglobina' (slightly more formal than original) and the addition of 'sin duda' which slightly shifts emphasis, though the Victorian detective tone is mostly maintained.

results.translated_text: Fui al bosque porque deseaba vivir de forma consciente, enfrentar solo los hechos esenciales de la vida y ver si podía aprender lo que tenía que enseñar, y no, cuando llegara el momento de morir, descubrir que no había vivido. No quería vivir una vida que no fuera una vida; vivir es tan valioso, y tampoco quería practicar la resignación, a menos que fuera absolutamente necesario. Quería vivir intensamente y extraer hasta la última gota de la esencia de la vida.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the philosophical meaning and structure well, with accurate rendering of Thoreau's key concepts like deliberate living and essential facts. Minor issues include 'extraer hasta la última gota' being slightly less poetic than the original 'suck out all the marrow,' and some slight awkwardness in the repetitive phrasing of 'una vida que no fuera una vida' compared to the original's more elegant construction.

results.translated_text: Llámame Ismael. Hace algunos años —no importa exactamente cuánto tiempo—, con poco o nada de dinero en mi bolsillo y sin nada en particular que me interesara en tierra firme, pensé que navegaría un poco y exploraría la parte acuática del mundo. Es una forma que tengo de ahuyentar la melancolía y regular la circulación. Cada vez que me encuentro con la boca sombría; cada vez que siento que es un noviembre húmedo y lluvioso en mi alma, considero que es hora de zarpar lo antes posible.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and narrative voice effectively, with mostly accurate renderings of Melville's philosophical musings. However, some archaic nuance is lost—'growing grim about the mouth' becomes 'con la boca sombría' (with a dark mouth) rather than capturing the original's subtle melancholy, and 'driving off the spleen' loses the period medical-philosophical resonance in 'ahuyentar la melancolía.' The fluency is generally natural Spanish, though slightly more modern

results.translated_text: È una verità universalmente riconosciuta che un uomo single e benestante debba necessariamente desiderare una moglie. Per quanto sconosciuti possano essere i sentimenti o le intenzioni di un tale uomo al momento del suo arrivo in un quartiere, questa verità è talmente radicata nelle menti delle famiglie circostanti, che egli viene considerato come la legittima preda di una delle loro figlie.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the meaning accurately with only minor issues: 'single' is awkwardly rendered as 'single' (English loanword) rather than the more natural 'scapolo,' and 'quartiere' (neighborhood/district) is slightly less precise than the original's social context. The ironic tone is mostly preserved, though 'preda' (prey) is more aggressive than Austen's 'property,' subtly shifting the satirical register.

results.translated_text: Lo studio era pervaso dal profumo intenso delle rose e, quando la leggera brezza estiva si insinuava tra gli alberi del giardino, dalla porta aperta giungeva il fragrante odore dei lillà, o il profumo più delicato dei cespugli di rose selvatiche. Dallo schienale del divano persiano, su cui era sdraiato a fumare, come al solito, un'infinità di sigarette, Lord Henry Wotton poteva scorgere appena il luccichio dei fiori giallo-ambra e dal dolce sapore di miele di un albero di bagolaro.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general sensory atmosphere but contains significant accuracy issues: 'pink-flowering thorn' is mistranslated as 'wild rose bushes,' 'divan of Persian saddle-bags' becomes 'back of the Persian divan' (losing the specific detail), and 'laburnum' is incorrectly rendered as 'bagolaro' (a different tree). While the Italian reads relatively naturally, these botanical and descriptive errors undermine both accuracy and the aesthetic precision essential to Wilde's style.

results.translated_text: «Lei è stato in Afghanistan, immagino.» «Come diavolo lo ha saputo?», chiesi, sbalordito. «Non importa», rispose, ridacchiando tra sé. «La questione ora riguarda l'emoglobina. Non è chiaro quanto sia importante questa mia scoperta?» «È interessante, chimicamente parlando, senza dubbio», risposi, «ma in pratica…» «Ma, signore, è la scoperta medico-legale più pratica degli ultimi anni. Non si rende conto che ci fornisce un metodo infallibile per identificare le macchie di sangue?»

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the dialogue's logical flow and character dynamics. Minor issues include 'immagino' being slightly softer than 'perceive,' and 'Ma, signore' adding emphasis not present in the original, though the overall tone and Victorian formality are well-preserved.

results.translated_text: Andai nel bosco perché desideravo vivere in modo consapevole, affrontare solo gli aspetti essenziali della vita e vedere se potevo imparare ciò che essa aveva da insegnare, e non, quando fosse giunto il momento di morire, scoprire di non aver vissuto veramente. Non volevo vivere una vita che non fosse vera vita, perché vivere è così prezioso; né volevo praticare la rassegnazione, a meno che non fosse assolutamente necessario. Volevo vivere intensamente e assaporare appieno ogni aspetto della vita.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures Thoreau's philosophical meaning and maintains natural Italian prose flow. However, 'assaporare appieno ogni aspetto della vita' slightly dilutes the visceral power of 'suck out all the marrow of life'—a key metaphor that deserves more literal rendering to preserve Thoreau's distinctive voice.

results.translated_text: Chiamatemi Ismaele. Alcuni anni fa – non importa quanto tempo precisamente – quando avevo poco o niente in tasca e non c’era nulla di particolare che mi tenesse a terra, pensai che avrei potuto fare un giro in barca per esplorare un po’ le acque del mondo. È un modo che ho per allontanare la malinconia e far ripartire la circolazione. Ogni volta che mi accorgo di diventare taciturno e cupo; ogni volta che nel mio animo è un novembre umido e piovoso, ritengo che sia giunto il momento di mettermi in mare il prima possibile.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and narrative voice well, with mostly natural Italian phrasing. However, some nuances are lost: 'money in my purse' becomes 'poco o niente in tasca' (less poetic), 'driving off the spleen' is simplified to 'allontanare la malinconia' (losing the medical/philosophical resonance), and 'grim about the mouth' becomes 'taciturno e cupo' (changing the physical specificity). The archaic literary tone is somewhat diminished in places.

results.translated_text: É uma verdade universalmente reconhecida que um homem solteiro com uma boa fortuna deve estar precisando de uma esposa. Por mais desconhecidas que sejam os sentimentos ou intenções desse homem ao chegar a um determinado bairro, essa verdade está tão arraigada na mente das famílias vizinhas que ele é considerado propriedade de uma de suas filhas.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the ironic tone of Austen's opening, though 'precisando de' is slightly less formal than the original's implication, and the final clause loses some of the original's nuanced 'some one or other' phrasing. The prose flows naturally in Portuguese with good vocabulary choices.

results.translated_text: O estúdio estava impregnado com o aroma intenso das rosas, e quando a leve brisa de verão soprava entre as árvores do jardim, o perfume forte das lilases ou a fragrância mais delicada do espinheiro de flores rosa invadiam o ambiente pela porta aberta. Do canto do divã forrado com tapeçarias persas, onde estava deitado, fumando, como era seu hábito, um número incontável de cigarros, Lord Henry Wotton podia vislumbrar o brilho das flores de cor mel e sabor adocicado de uma árvore-do-paraíso.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness and meaning, though some aesthetic precision is lost: 'saddle-bags' becomes 'tapeçarias' (tapestries), and 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' is awkwardly rendered as 'sabor adocicado' (sweet taste) rather than maintaining the visual-olfactory duality. The prose flows naturally in Portuguese but lacks some of Wilde's delicate aesthetic refinement.

results.translated_text: “Percebo que você esteve no Afeganistão”, disse ele. “Como diabos você descobriu isso?”, perguntei, surpreso. “Não importa”, respondeu ele, rindo para si mesmo. “A questão agora é sobre a hemoglobina. Sem dúvida, você percebe a importância desta minha descoberta?” “É interessante, quimicamente falando, sem dúvida”, respondi. “Mas, na prática…” “Ora, meu caro, é a descoberta médico-legal mais prática dos últimos anos. Você não percebe que isso nos dá um teste infalível para manchas de sangue?”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the logical flow of the dialogue, though 'descobriu' (discovered) slightly shifts the nuance of 'know' and 'chuckling to himself' becomes 'rindo para si mesmo' (laughing to himself), which is acceptable. The style is mostly preserved with appropriate formality, though 'Ora, meu caro' adds a slightly different tone than the original's directness, and the Victorian-era voice could be subtly sharper in Portuguese.

results.translated_text: Fui para a floresta porque desejava viver de forma consciente, encarar apenas os aspectos essenciais da vida e ver se conseguiria aprender o que ela tinha a ensinar, e não, quando chegasse a hora de morrer, descobrir que não havia vivido. Não queria viver uma vida superficial, pois a vida é tão preciosa; nem queria me resignar, a menos que fosse absolutamente necessário. Queria viver intensamente e extrair o máximo de prazer da vida.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the philosophical meaning and structure well, with natural Portuguese phrasing. However, 'extrair o máximo de prazer' slightly softens Thoreau's visceral 'suck out all the marrow,' and 'vida superficial' is an interpretation rather than a direct rendering of 'what was not life,' losing some of the original's existential precision.

results.translated_text: Chame-me Ishmael. Há alguns anos — não importa exatamente quantos — com pouco ou nenhum dinheiro no bolso e sem nada de interessante para fazer em terra, pensei em navegar um pouco e explorar a parte aquática do mundo. É uma forma que tenho de combater o tédio e regular a minha disposição. Sempre que me sinto de mau humor; sempre que sinto que é um novembro úmido e chuvoso na minha alma, considero que é altura de ir para o mar o mais depressa possível.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and narrative voice well, but loses some of Melville's archaic formality and philosophical weight. Phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become 'combater o tédio' (fighting tedium), which is more modern and less evocative than the original's medical-philosophical tone.

results.translated_text: Powszechnie wiadomo, że każdy niezamężny mężczyzna, posiadający pokaźny majątek, musi potrzebować żony. Choć mało kto zna jego uczucia i poglądy w momencie, gdy po raz pierwszy pojawia się w okolicy, ta prawda jest tak głęboko zakorzeniona w umysłach okolicznych rodzin, że uważają go za prawowity cel dla którejś ze swoich córek.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone well, though 'cel' (target/aim) is slightly weaker than the original's 'property' metaphor, and the phrasing occasionally feels more literal than Austen's elegant irony demands. The opening is solid but lacks some of the original's satirical bite.

results.translated_text: Studio wypełniał bogaty zapach róż, a gdy lekki letni wiatr poruszał gałęziami drzew w ogrodzie, przez otwarte drzwi dobiegał ciężki zapach bzu lub delikatniejszy aromat różowej dzikiej róży. Z kąta perskiego dywanu, na którym leżał, paląc, jak zwykle, niezliczoną ilość papierosów, lord Henry Wotton mógł dostrzec połysk słodkich, miodowych i miodowożółtych kwiatów złotokrzewa.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness and meaning, though some aesthetic nuances are lost: 'saddle-bags' becomes 'divan' (losing the specific detail), 'pink-flowering thorn' becomes 'wild rose' (different plant), and 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' loses some poetic redundancy. The prose reads naturally in Polish but lacks the flowing musicality of Wilde's original aesthetic prose.

results.translated_text:
– Wygląda na to, że byłeś w Afganistanie – zauważył.
– Skąd właściwie to wiesz? – zapytałem ze zdziwieniem.
– Nic z tego – odparł, śmiejąc się pod nosem. – Teraz ważniejsze jest to, że chodzi o hemoglobinę. Czy dostrzegasz znaczenie tego odkrycia?
– Bez wątpienia jest ono interesujące z chemicznego punktu widzenia – odpowiedziałem – ale w praktyce…
– Jak to w praktyce? To najważniejsze odkrycie w dziedzinie medycyny sądowej od wielu lat. Czyż nie widzisz, że daje nam ono niezawodną metodę identyfikacji plam krwi?

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue flow of the original, with natural Polish phrasing that reads well. Minor style considerations: 'Nic z tego' is slightly informal compared to Holmes's typical dismissive tone, and some of the original's Victorian precision is softened, but overall the character dynamics and scientific discussion are effectively conveyed.

results.translated_text: Poszedłem do lasu, ponieważ chciałem żyć świadomie, mierzyć się tylko z najważniejszymi aspektami życia i sprawdzić, czy nie mógłbym się czegoś nauczyć, aby w chwili śmierci nie okazało się, że w ogóle nie żyłem. Nie chciałem prowadzić życia, które nie jest prawdziwym życiem, bo życie jest zbyt cenne, ani nie chciałem praktykować rezygnacji, chyba że byłaby ona absolutnie konieczna. Chciałem żyć intensywnie i czerpać z życia pełnymi garściami.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical essence and most key meanings well, with natural Polish phrasing. However, 'mierzyć się' (to confront/measure oneself) is less precise than 'front' (to face directly), and 'czerpać z życia pełnymi garściami' (draw from life with full hands) loses some of the visceral intensity of 'suck out all the marrow,' though it conveys similar meaning idiomatically.

results.translated_text: Nazywajcie mnie Ismaelem. Kilka lat temu – nie ważne dokładnie ile – kiedy w portfelu miałem niewiele lub wcale pieniędzy, a na lądzie nie było nic, co by mnie szczególnie interesowało, pomyślałem, że popłynę trochę po świecie i zobaczę jego wodną część. To mój sposób na przepędzanie złych myśli i regulowanie krążenia. Kiedy tylko zauważam, że zaczynam się smucić; kiedy tylko w mojej duszy panuje szara, deszczowa listopadowa pogoda, wiem, że najwyższy czas, aby jak najszybciej wypłynąć w morze.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the core meaning and narrative voice well, but loses some of the original's archaic formality and poetic nuance. Phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become more literal ('przepędzanie złych myśli'), and the metaphorical richness of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' is somewhat flattened into 'szara, deszczowa listopadowa pogoda,' reducing the psychological depth Melville intended.

results.translated_text: 一个普遍被大家认可的道理是，只要一个单身男子拥有不错的财富，他就一定需要一位妻子。尽管我们可能不太了解这位男子刚来到某个社区时的想法和感受，但这个道理已经深深地印在周围家庭的脑海中，他们认为他理应成为他们女儿中的某一位的丈夫。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's signature ironic tone and elegant simplicity. The phrasing is somewhat awkward and verbose compared to the original's witty, paradoxical opening, and 'rightful property' becomes '理应成为...的丈夫' which dilutes the satirical bite of the original observation about women being treated as possessions.

results.translated_text: 工作室里弥漫着浓郁的玫瑰香气。当轻柔的夏风吹拂着花园里的树木时，一股浓郁的紫丁香香或一种更为清新的粉色花朵的香气，便从敞开的门中飘了进来。亨利·沃顿勋爵正躺在铺着波斯马鞍布的沙发角落里，像往常一样，不停地抽着烟。他可以隐约看到一棵金合欢树上，那蜂蜜般香甜、颜色也像蜂蜜一样的花朵。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning and sensory details effectively, though some nuances are lost—notably the poetic compression of 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' becomes more explanatory. The fluency is generally natural in Chinese, but the sentence structure occasionally feels more rigid than Wilde's flowing prose, and the aesthetic sensibility is slightly diminished.

results.translated_text: “我看得出，您去过阿富汗。”“您是怎么知道的？”我惊讶地问道。“没关系，”他笑着说，“现在的问题是关于血红蛋白的。您一定明白这项发现的重要性吧？”“从化学角度来看，这确实很有趣，”我回答说，“但从实际应用角度来看……”“这可是近年来最重要的医学法律发现。难道您没意识到，它为我们提供了一种可靠的血液检测方法吗？”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and dialogue flow of the original text, with natural Chinese phrasing. Minor deviations include 'medico-legal' rendered as '医学法律' (slightly awkward) rather than a more precise legal-medical term, and the conversational tone could be slightly more colloquial to match Holmes's characteristic manner.

results.translated_text: 我走进森林，是因为我渴望有意识地生活，直面生活中最基本的事实，并探寻它是否能教会我一些东西。我不想在临终时才发现，我根本没有真正地活着。我不想过那种虚度光阴的生活，因为生命是如此珍贵；我也不想练习消极的顺从，除非确实有必要。我想要深入地生活，竭尽全力地体验生命中的一切美好。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core philosophical meaning and maintains good readability in Chinese, but slightly softens Thoreau's intensity with phrases like '体验生命中的一切美好' (experience all beauty in life) instead of the more visceral 'suck out all the marrow of life,' and misses some nuance in the original's paradoxical structure around 'living is so dear.'

results.translated_text: 请叫我以实玛利。大约在几年前——确切地说，多少年已经不重要了——我身无分文，也没有什么事情能让我对岸上的生活产生兴趣，于是我想，不如去海上转一转，看看这个世界的海洋部分。这是我排遣忧郁、调节情绪的一种方式。每当我感到自己变得郁郁寡欢；每当我的内心都像阴冷的十一月，下着淅淅沥沥的小雨时，我就认为是时候尽快出海了。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and philosophical tone of Melville's opening, with good handling of the metaphorical language about melancholy. However, some archaic formality is lost, and phrases like '请叫我' feel slightly modern compared to the original's timeless quality; the poetic compression of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' becomes more literal and less evocative in Chinese.

results.translated_text: 眾所周知，一個擁有財富的單身男子，必定渴望娶一位妻子。儘管人們對這位男子最初到來時的感受或想法可能知之甚少，但這個道理已經深深地植根於周圍家庭的觀念中，他們認為這位男子理應成為其中一位女兒的配偶。

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the core meaning and logical structure of Austen's opening, but softens the ironic bite through more literal phrasing. The famous opening's satirical tone—where Austen's irony critiques societal assumptions—is somewhat diluted; 'must be in want of' becomes 'must desire,' losing the subtle mockery of the original's deadpan assertion.

results.translated_text: 工作室裡瀰漫著濃郁的玫瑰香氣。當輕柔的夏日微風穿過花園裡的樹木時，從敞開的門口飄來陣陣紫丁香的濃郁香氣，或是更加淡雅的粉色山楂花香。從鋪滿波斯式馬鞍墊的長椅一角，他躺著，像往常一樣，不停地抽著一支又一支香菸。從這個位置，亨利·沃頓勳爵正好能看到一株金合歡樹，它閃爍著蜂蜜般甜美、蜂蜜般金黃色的花朵。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory details and meaning accurately, though some nuances are lost—particularly the poetic flow of Wilde's original prose and the seamless integration of aesthetic descriptions. The phrase structure becomes more fragmented in Chinese, and the elegant rhythm of the original is somewhat diminished, though the luxurious atmosphere is still conveyed effectively.

results.translated_text: 「我看得出，您去過阿富汗。」我驚訝地問道：「您到底怎麼知道的？」他笑著說：「先不提這些，現在的問題是關於血紅素。您難道沒有意識到我這個發現的重要性嗎？」我回答說：「從化學的角度來看，的確很有趣，但從實際應用來看——」他回答說：「這簡直是近幾年來最重要的醫學和法醫學發現。您難道沒有意識到，這讓我們有了一種可以準確檢測血跡的方法嗎？」

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and scientific discussion accurately, but has structural issues: the dialogue attribution is confused (mixing who says what), and the conversational flow is disrupted by awkward phrasing like repeated "難道沒有意識到" that doesn't match the original's natural rhythm. The tone becomes more formal than Doyle's characteristic brisk, engaging dialogue.

results.translated_text: 我來到森林，是因為我想過一種有意義的生活，直面生活中最基本的事實，並試圖從中學習，而不是等到臨終之際，才發現自己根本沒有真正活過。我不希望過一種虛假的生活，因為生命是如此珍貴；我也不想勉強自己學會忍耐，除非那實在是不可避免的。我想要深入地體驗生活，盡情地品味生活中的所有美好。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core philosophical meaning and intent well, with natural Chinese prose flow. However, it slightly softens Thoreau's intensity—'盡情地品味生活中的所有美好' (savor all the beauty in life) dilutes the raw viscerality of 'suck out all the marrow of life,' and some nuances of the original's deliberate repetition and paradoxes are muted.

results.translated_text: 你可以叫我以實瑪利。那是幾年前的事了，具體是多久，已經不重要了。當時我身無分文，而且在陸地上也沒有什麼特別的事情可以讓我感興趣，於是我心想，不如去海上航行一番，看看這個世界的水域。這是我排遣憂鬱、調節情緒的一種方式。每當我發現自己臉色變得陰沉；每當我的心靈都籠罩在陰濕、多雨的十一月氛圍中，我就覺得該儘快出海了。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and narrative voice reasonably well, though some nuances are lost—particularly the idiomatic expressions like 'driving off the spleen' and 'regulating the circulation' which carry specific 19th-century philosophical weight. The archaic literary tone is partially preserved but reads somewhat more modern and less contemplative than Melville's original meditative prose.

results.translated_text: 独身でそれなりの財産を持つ男性は、妻を必要としている、というのは、広く認められている事実である。そのような男性が新しい地域にやってきて、その人物の感情や考えがまだよく知られていないとしても、この事実は周囲の人々の心に深く刻まれているため、彼は、その地域に住む娘たちの誰かの「当然の所有物」とみなされるのである。

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the core meaning and captures Austen's ironic commentary on marriage conventions, though some nuance is lost in the opening phrase's universality claim. The prose is generally natural but occasionally reads more formal/stilted than the original's elegant flow, and the ironic tone could be slightly sharper.

results.translated_text: アトリエはバラの濃厚な香りで満たされ、庭の木々の間で軽い夏の風が吹き抜けると、開いたドアからライラックの重厚な香り、あるいはピンクの花を咲かせた茨の繊細な香りが漂ってきた。ペルシャの鞍掛けで作られたソファに横たわり、いつものように数えきれないほどのタバコを吸っていたロード・ヘンリー・ウォットンは、そこから、蜂蜜のように甘く、蜂蜜色のラバーナムの花がちらりと見えるのを目にすることができた。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning and sensory details accurately, but the sentence structure becomes awkward and convoluted, particularly in the final clause, disrupting the flowing aesthetic prose that defines Wilde's style. Some phrasing choices ('数えきれないほどのタバコを吸っていた' for smoking cigarettes) feel slightly unnatural in Japanese.

results.translated_text: 「あなたはアフガニスタンにいたことがあるのですね」と彼は言った。「一体、どうしてそれが分かったのですか？」私は驚いて尋ねた。「気にしないでください」と彼は笑いながら言った。「今問題なのはヘモグロビンについてです。私のこの発見の意義について、あなたも理解しているはずです？」私は答えた。「化学的には興味深いことは確かですが、実際には——」。「いや、これは何年もで最も実用的な法医学的な発見なのです。それが、血液の痕跡を確実に検出できる方法になることに、あなたは気づいていないのですか？」

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and dialogue structure well, but has minor issues: the opening attribution is awkwardly placed, some phrasing feels slightly stiff (e.g., '気にしないでください' is too formal for Holmes's casual tone), and the final sentence's construction ('それが、血液の痕跡を確実に検出できる方法になることに') is somewhat convoluted compared to the original's directness. The Victorian-era conversational style and Holmes's characteristic confidence could be better preserved.

results.translated_text: 私は、意識的に生きたい、人生の本質的な事実にのみ向き合い、そこから何を学べるか試したい、そして、死ぬときに、自分が本当に生きたかどうかを後悔しないようにしたい、という思いから森へ行った。生きていないような生を送りたくなかったし、人生はかけがえのないものだから。また、必要でない限り、諦めたり、運命を受け入れたりすることも望まなかった。私は、人生を深く味わい、その髄まで吸い尽くしたいと願っていた。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core philosophical meaning and intent of Thoreau's passage well, with accurate rendering of key concepts like deliberate living and extracting life's essence. However, some nuances are lost—the original's rhetorical power and parallel structure are somewhat diminished, and phrases like 'practise resignation' become slightly awkward as '諦めたり、運命を受け入れたりすることも望まなかった,' affecting the lyrical flow characteristic of Thoreau's prose.

results.translated_text: わしをイシュメールと呼んでくれ。何年か前のことだ。正確な年数は思い出せないが、財布の中にはほとんどお金がなく、陸の上で特に興味を引くこともない。そこで、少し海に出て、この世界の海を眺めてみることにしたのだ。それは、わしが憂鬱な気分を吹き飛ばし、気分転換をするための方法なのだ。もしわしが、口元が険しくなってきて、気分が沈み、まるで心の中にどんよりとした曇り空が広がるようなら、それはすぐに海に出るべき時だとわしは思うのだ。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses some nuance (e.g., 'spleen' and 'circulation' become generic mood-regulation, 'damp, drizzly November' is oversimplified). The archaic literary tone is partially preserved through 'わし' but the prose feels less elegant and more explanatory than Melville's original, with some awkward constructions that don't flow naturally in Japanese.

results.translated_text: 꽤 많은 재산을 가진 미혼 남성은 반드시 아내가 필요하다는 것은 널리 알려진 사실이다. 그 남성이 어떤 생각을 가지고 있든, 처음 동네에 나타났을 때 그의 감정이나 관점은 잘 알려져 있지 않을 수도 있다. 하지만 이 진실은 주변 사람들의 마음속에 깊이 자리 잡고 있어서, 그들은 그 남성이 자신들의 딸들 중 한 명의 몫으로 정해져 있다고 생각한다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses Austen's signature ironic tone and the elegant paradox of the opening. The phrase '꽤 많은 재산을 가진' is weaker than the original's emphasis on 'good fortune,' and the translation becomes more literal and explanatory rather than maintaining the subtle irony that makes the original so distinctive.

results.translated_text: 아늑한 스튜디오 안에는 장미의 진한 향기가 가득했고, 여름의 미풍이 정원의 나무 사이로 불어올 때, 열린 문을 통해 라일락의 짙은 향기나 분홍색 꽃이 피어 있는 가시덤불의 은은한 향기가 스며들었다. 페르시아 안장 가죽으로 만든 소파 구석에 누워 담배를 피우고 있던 헨리 워턴 경은 수많은 담배를 피우는 습관이 있었다. 그는 그곳에서 꿀처럼 달콤하고 꿀색을 띤 라부르눔 꽃이 반짝이는 것을 어렴풋이 볼 수 있었다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but loses significant nuance and sensory richness. Major issues include awkward phrasing ("안장 가죽으로 만든 소파" is clunky), a fragmented sentence structure that disrupts the flowing prose style, and the insertion of "수많은 담배를 피우는 습관이 있었다" which breaks the original's elegant construction and creates redundancy with the earlier smoking reference.

results.translated_text: “아프가니스탄에 가본 적이 있군요.” “어떻게 그걸 아셨어요?” 저는 깜짝 놀라며 물었습니다. 그는 껄껄 웃으며 “신경 쓰지 마세요.”라고 말했습니다. “지금은 헤모글로빈에 대한 이야기입니다. 제 발견이 얼마나 중요한지 아시겠죠?” “화학적으로는 흥미롭지만, 실질적으로는—”라고 대답했습니다. “이게 얼마나 실용적인 의학적, 법적 발견인지 모르시나요? 이제 혈흔을 완벽하게 판별할 수 있는 확실한 방법을 갖게 된 겁니다.”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and maintains the dialogue structure, though some nuances are slightly altered (e.g., 'Never mind' becomes '신경 쓰지 마세요' which is more casual). The fluency is good but occasionally feels slightly formal or constructed rather than naturally conversational, and the Victorian-era tone is somewhat softened in the Korean rendering.

results.translated_text: 나는 숲으로 갔는데, 그 이유는 의도적으로 삶을 살고 싶었기 때문이다. 삶의 본질적인 사실에만 집중하고, 숲이 무엇을 가르쳐 줄 수 있는지 알고 싶었다. 죽음을 맞이했을 때, 내가 진정으로 살지 않았다는 것을 깨닫고 싶지 않았다. 삶이 아닌 것을 살고 싶지도 않았고, 삶은 너무나 소중하다. 그리고 꼭 필요하지 않다면 체념을 실천하고 싶지도 않았다. 나는 삶을 깊이 살고, 삶의 모든 것을 빨아들이고 싶었다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning but loses some philosophical nuance and poetic intensity. The phrase '삶의 모든 것을 빨아들이고' (suck out all of life) is somewhat awkward in Korean, and the flowing, meditative rhythm of the original is disrupted by more fragmented sentence structures.

results.translated_text: 내 이름을 이스마엘이라고 불러 주게. 몇 년 전, 정확히 얼마나 오래되었는지는 중요하지 않지만, 지갑에는 돈이 거의 없었고, 육지에서 특별히 흥미를 끄는 일도 없어서, 바다를 좀 돌아다니며 세상의 물이 많은 부분을 구경해 보겠다고 생각했지. 그건 내가 우울함을 떨쳐내고 기분을 좋게 하는 방법이야. 내가 입가가 굳어지고, 내 마음속에 축축하고 음울한 11월이 찾아올 때면, 가능한 한 빨리 바다로 나가야 할 때라고 생각하지.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and narrative voice but loses some of Melville's archaic formality and philosophical nuance; phrases like '기분을 좋게 하는' (making mood better) oversimplify 'regulating the circulation,' and the overall tone feels more conversational than the original's measured, contemplative register.

results.translated_text: Người ta thường nói, một người đàn ông độc thân có tài sản, chắc chắn sẽ cần một người vợ. Dù cảm xúc hay suy nghĩ của người đàn ông đó có thể chưa được mọi người biết đến khi anh ta mới chuyển đến một khu dân cư, nhưng sự thật này đã ăn sâu vào tâm trí của những gia đình xung quanh, đến mức họ xem anh ta như một đối tượng phù hợp để kết hôn với một trong những cô con gái của họ.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's distinctive ironic voice and formal elegance. The opening lacks the universality and satirical bite of the original, and 'đối tượng phù hợp để kết hôn' is awkward compared to the original's 'rightful property' which carries sharper irony.

results.translated_text: Căn phòng tràn ngập mùi thơm nồng nàn của hoa hồng, và mỗi khi làn gió mùa hè nhẹ nhàng thổi qua những hàng cây trong vườn, hương thơm đậm đà của cây tử đằng hoặc mùi hương tinh tế hơn của cây bụi hoa hồng sẽ lan tỏa qua cánh cửa mở. Từ góc chiếc ghế dài bọc vải ba tư mà Lord Henry Wotton thường ngồi, vừa hút thuốc, ông có thể thoáng thấy những chùm hoa màu vàng mật ong của cây cây me tây.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory details and meaning, but loses some aesthetic precision (e.g., 'divan of Persian saddle-bags' becomes generic 'ghế dài bọc vải ba tư', 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' is simplified to just 'màu vàng mật ong'). The prose feels somewhat stilted and less flowing than Wilde's original, with awkward phrasing like 'cây cây me tây' that disrupts the lyrical quality.

results.translated_text: “Tôi nhận thấy anh đã từng ở Afghanistan,” ông nói. “Thật không thể tin được, làm sao ông biết được?” tôi hỏi, giọng đầy kinh ngạc. “Không sao,” ông đáp, cười khúc khích. “Vấn đề bây giờ là về hemoglobin. Chắc hẳn anh cũng nhận ra tầm quan trọng của phát hiện này của tôi chứ?” “Nó thú vị về mặt hóa học, không thể phủ nhận,” tôi trả lời, “nhưng về mặt thực tế thì…” “Thôi nào, đây là một phát hiện y học và pháp y thực tiễn nhất trong nhiều năm qua. Anh có thấy rằng nó mang đến một phương pháp kiểm tra không thể sai sót cho các vết máu không?”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue flow of the original text, with appropriate Vietnamese conversational markers and technical terminology. Minor stylistic adjustments (such as "Thôi nào" for emphasis) slightly alter the original's precise tone, but the overall character voice and intellectual exchange remain well-maintained.

results.translated_text: Tôi đến khu rừng vì muốn sống một cuộc đời có ý nghĩa, đối diện với những sự thật thiết yếu của cuộc sống, và xem liệu tôi có thể học hỏi được gì từ nó hay không, để khi đến lúc chết, tôi không phải hối tiếc vì đã không thực sự sống. Tôi không muốn sống một cuộc đời vô nghĩa, vì cuộc sống quá quý giá; cũng không muốn cam chịu số phận nếu không thực sự cần thiết. Tôi muốn sống trọn vẹn và tận hưởng mọi khoảnh khắc của cuộc sống.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core philosophical meaning and maintains good readability in Vietnamese, but softens Thoreau's intensity with phrases like 'tận hưởng mọi khoảnh khắc' instead of the more visceral 'suck out all the marrow,' and loses some of the original's deliberate, aphoristic rhythm and paradoxical force.

results.translated_text: Hãy gọi tôi là Ishmael. Cách đây vài năm – không cần phải nói chính xác là bao lâu – khi trong túi tôi hầu như không còn đồng xu nào, và cũng chẳng có gì đặc biệt để khiến tôi hứng thú khi ở trên bờ, tôi nghĩ rằng mình sẽ đi du ngoạn một chút và khám phá thế giới dưới biển. Đó là một cách để tôi giải tỏa sự bực bội và điều hòa lại cơ thể. Bất cứ khi nào tôi thấy mình trở nên ủ rũ; bất cứ khi nào tâm hồn tôi chìm đắm trong những ngày tháng mờ u ẩm ướt của tháng Mười Một, tôi biết rằng đã đến lúc phải ra khơi càng sớm càng tốt.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and narrative voice reasonably well, though some nuances are lost—'spleen' becomes generic 'bực bội' rather than preserving the melancholic philosophical weight, and 'watery part of the world' shifts to 'thế giới dưới biển' (underwater world) which slightly alters Melville's meaning. The archaic, contemplative tone is somewhat diminished in the Vietnamese rendering, which reads more straightforward than the original's philosophical cadence.

results.translated_text: เป็นที่ทราบกันดีอยู่แล้วว่า ชายโสดผู้หนึ่งที่มีฐานะร่ำรวย ย่อมต้องการภรรยา อย่างไรก็ตาม แม้ว่าเราจะยังไม่รู้จักความรู้สึกหรือความคิดของเขา เมื่อเขาเข้ามาอยู่ในละแวกบ้าน ความจริงข้อนี้ก็ฝังแน่นอยู่ในจิตใจของครอบครัวที่อยู่รอบข้าง จนพวกเขาคิดว่าเขาเป็นของที่ควรจะเป็นของลูกสาวคนใดคนหนึ่งในบ้าน

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone effectively, preserving Austen's satirical commentary on marriage customs. Minor fluency issues with slightly awkward phrasing ('ของที่ควรจะเป็นของ') and some loss of the original's elegant rhythm prevent a higher score.

results.translated_text: กลิ่นหอมของดอกกุหลาบอบอวลไปทั่วสตูดิโอ และเมื่อสายลมในฤดูร้อนพัดผ่านต้นไม้ในสวน กลิ่นหอมเข้มข้นของดอกไลแลค หรือกลิ่นหอมอ่อนละมุนของดอกกุหลาบสีชมพู ก็จะลอยเข้ามาตามประตูที่เปิดแง้ม จากมุมโซฟาที่ทำจากผ้าเปอร์เซีย ซึ่งลอร์ดเฮนรี วอตตันนอนสูบบุหรี่เป็นจำนวนมากตามปกติ เขาพอจะเห็นแสงสะท้อนจากดอกไม้สีน้ำผึ้งของต้นแล็บเบอร์นัม

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning and sensory details, but loses some aesthetic refinement through awkward phrasing (e.g., 'ดอกกุหลาบสีชมพู' for 'pink-flowering thorn' misidentifies the flower) and the poetic flow of Wilde's prose is diminished by structural changes that make it feel more prosaic than the original's lyrical quality.

results.translated_text: “ดูเหมือนว่าคุณเคยไปอัฟกานิสถานมา” “คุณรู้ได้อย่างไร?” ผมถามด้วยความประหลาดใจ “ไม่เป็นไร” เขาตอบพลางหัวเราะคิกคัก “คำถามตอนนี้คือเรื่องฮีโมโกลบิน คุณคงเห็นถึงความสำคัญของการค้นพบของผมแล้วใช่ไหม?” “มันน่าสนใจในแง่เคมีอย่างแน่นอน” ผมตอบ “แต่ในแง่ของการนำไปใช้จริง—” “นี่เป็นสิ่งประดิษฐ์ทางการแพทย์และนิติวิทยาศาสตร์ที่มีประโยชน์มากที่สุดในช่วงหลายปีที่ผ่านมา คุณไม่เห็นหรือว่ามันจะช่วยให้เราสามารถตรวจหาคราบเลือดได้อย่างแม่นยำ?”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning of the original dialogue, preserving Watson's astonishment and Holmes's deductive confidence. However, some phrasing feels slightly formal or awkward (e.g., 'สิ่งประดิษฐ์ทางการแพทย์' for 'discovery'), and the conversational flow could be more natural to better capture the Victorian-era dialogue's distinctive voice.

results.translated_text: ข้าพเจ้าเข้าไปในป่า เพราะปรารถนาที่จะใช้ชีวิตอย่างมีสติ เพื่อเผชิญหน้ากับความจริงที่สำคัญของชีวิต และเพื่อเรียนรู้สิ่งที่ป่าแห่งนี้จะสอน และเมื่อถึงเวลาที่ข้าพเจ้าจะตาย ข้าพเจ้าจะได้ไม่ต้องค้นพบว่าข้าพเจ้ายังไม่ได้ใช้ชีวิตอย่างแท้จริง ข้าพเจ้าไม่ปรารถนาที่จะใช้ชีวิตในสิ่งที่มิใช่ชีวิต เพราะชีวิตนั้นมีค่าเกินกว่าจะปล่อยให้สูญเปล่า และข้าพเจ้าไม่ปรารถนาที่จะยอมจำนนต่อชะตากรรม เว้นแต่ว่ามันเป็นสิ่งที่หลีกเลี่ยงไม่ได้ ข้าพเจ้าต้องการใช้ชีวิตอย่างลึกซึ้ง และดื่มด่ำกับทุกแง่มุมของชีวิต

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core philosophical meaning and maintains logical coherence, though some nuances are lost—particularly the metaphorical intensity of 'suck out all the marrow' becomes diluted to 'drink in all aspects,' and the original's rhythmic parallelism is somewhat flattened in Thai. The formal register is appropriate but occasionally feels slightly stiff compared to Thoreau's deliberate, meditative prose.

results.translated_text: เรียกฉันว่าอิชเมลก็แล้วกัน เมื่อหลายปีก่อน—ไม่สำคัญว่าจะกี่ปีที่แล้ว—เมื่อเงินในกระเป๋าแทบไม่มี และไม่มีอะไรบนบกที่น่าสนใจ ฉันจึงคิดว่าจะลองออกทะเลสักหน่อย เพื่อจะได้สำรวจโลกในส่วนที่เป็นน้ำดู มันเป็นวิธีที่ฉันใช้คลายความเบื่อหน่ายและปรับสมดุลร่างกาย ทุกครั้งที่ฉันรู้สึกว่าอารมณ์เริ่มหม่นหมอง ทุกครั้งที่จิตใจฉันเหมือนอยู่ในช่วงปลายฤดูใบไม้ร่วงที่แสนจะอึมครึม ฉันจะถือว่าถึงเวลาที่ต้องออกไปทะเลโดยเร็วที่สุด

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and narrative voice effectively, though some nuances are lost—particularly the metaphorical depth of 'spleen' (rendered as generic 'boredom') and the archaic formality is somewhat softened in Thai. The prose reads naturally in Thai but lacks the distinctive melancholic, philosophical tone of Melville's original.

results.translated_text: यह एक सर्वमान्य सत्य है कि यदि किसी अविवाहित व्यक्ति के पास अच्छी संपत्ति है, तो उसे निश्चित रूप से एक पत्नी की आवश्यकता होती है। भले ही उस व्यक्ति की भावनाओं या विचारों को किसी नए इलाके में आने पर कम ही जाना जाता हो, फिर भी यह सत्य आसपास के परिवारों के मन में इतनी गहराई से बस जाता है कि उन्हें लगता है कि वह किसी न किसी रूप में उनके किसी बेटी के लिए ही बना है।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone effectively, with accurate conveyance of the satirical commentary on marriage and social expectations. Minor fluency issues arise from slightly awkward phrasing ('उन्हें लगता है कि वह किसी न किसी रूप में उनके किसी बेटी के लिए ही बना है') that could be more elegantly rendered, and the opening's ironic weight is marginally softened by the conditional 'यदि' rather than the more assertive original.

results.translated_text: स्टूडियो में गुलाब की मनमोहक सुगंध फैली हुई थी, और जब हल्की गर्मियों की हवा बगीचे के पेड़ों के बीच से गुजरती थी, तो खुले दरवाजे से लिलेक की तीव्र सुगंध या गुलाबी फूलों वाले कांटेदार पौधे की हल्की खुशबू आती थी। फ़ारसी सैडल-बैग से बने सोफ़े के कोने में, जिस पर वह लेटा हुआ था और हमेशा की तरह, अनगिनत सिगरेट पी रहा था, लॉर्ड हेनरी वॉट्टन मुश्किल से लैबर्नम के शहद जैसे मीठे और शहद के रंग के फूलों की चमक देख सकता था।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the sensory richness and aesthetic details of the original with good fidelity, though some poetic nuance is lost in phrasing. The Hindi rendering is generally natural but occasionally awkward (e.g., 'पी रहा था' for smoking cigarettes is slightly imprecise), and the lyrical flow of Wilde's prose is somewhat diminished despite preserving the core imagery.

results.translated_text: “मुझे लगता है, आप अफ़गानिस्तान में रहे हैं।” “आपने यह कैसे जान लिया?” मैंने आश्चर्य से पूछा। “कोई बात नहीं,” उसने मुस्कुराते हुए कहा। “अब सवाल हेमोग्लोबिन के बारे में है। क्या आपको मेरी इस खोज के महत्व का पता है?” “यह रसायन विज्ञान के दृष्टिकोण से निश्चित रूप से दिलचस्प है,” मैंने उत्तर दिया, “लेकिन व्यावहारिक रूप से—” “नहीं, मेरे दोस्त, यह वर्षों में की गई सबसे व्यावहारिक चिकित्सा-कानूनी खोज है। क्या आपको नहीं लगता कि यह हमें रक्त के धब्बों के लिए एक अचूक परीक्षण प्रदान करता है?”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue structure with only minor deviations (e.g., 'मुझे लगता है' is slightly softer than 'I perceive'). While the Hindi reads naturally in most places, some phrases like 'रसायन विज्ञान के दृष्टिकोण से' feel slightly formal compared to the original's conversational tone, and the addition of 'मेरे दोस्त' (my friend) adds an element not in the source text.

results.translated_text: मैं जंगल में इसलिए गया क्योंकि मैं जानबूझकर जीना चाहता था, जीवन के केवल आवश्यक पहलुओं का सामना करना चाहता था, और यह देखना चाहता था कि क्या मैं उससे कुछ सीख सकता हूँ, और जब मेरा अंत आएगा, तो यह न पता चले कि मैंने जीवन नहीं जिया। मैं ऐसा जीवन नहीं जीना चाहता था जो जीवन न हो, क्योंकि जीवन बहुत अनमोल है; और न ही मैं त्याग का अभ्यास करना चाहता था, जब तक कि यह बिल्कुल आवश्यक न हो। मैं गहराई से जीना चाहता था और जीवन के हर रस का आनंद लेना चाहता था।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical essence and meaning of Thoreau's passage accurately, with faithful rendering of key concepts like deliberate living and extracting life's marrow. However, some stylistic nuances are softened—'suck out all the marrow' becomes 'आनंद लेना' (enjoy), losing the visceral intensity of the original metaphor, and the rhythmic parallelism of Thoreau's prose is somewhat diminished in the Hindi version.

results.translated_text: मेरा नाम इश्माएल है। कुछ साल पहले—ठीक कितने साल, यह अब मायने नहीं रखता—जब मेरे पास जेब में बहुत कम या बिल्कुल भी पैसे नहीं थे, और किनारे पर मुझे किसी चीज में कोई खास दिलचस्पी नहीं थी, तो मैंने सोचा कि मैं थोड़ा घूमकर दुनिया का जलीय भाग देख लूं। यह मेरे उदासी को दूर करने और शरीर में रक्त प्रवाह को सामान्य करने का एक तरीका है। जब भी मैं देखता हूँ कि मेरा चेहरा उदास हो रहा है; जब भी मेरे अंदर एक उदास, धुंधला नवंबर जैसा माहौल छा जाता है, तो मुझे लगता है कि यह समुद्र में जाने का सही समय है, ताकि मैं जल्द से जल्द वहां पहुंच सकूं।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately but loses the poetic subtlety and archaic tone of the original. Phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become overly literal ('उदासी को दूर करना'), and the philosophical introspection feels diminished through more straightforward Hindi phrasing, reducing the literary elegance characteristic of Melville's prose.

results.translated_text: এটা সর্বজনবিদিত একটি সত্য যে, ভালো সম্পত্তি আছে এমন একজন অবিবাহিত পুরুষকে অবশ্যই একজন স্ত্রীর প্রয়োজন হবে। কোনো ব্যক্তি যখন প্রথমবার কোনো এলাকায় আসে, তখন তার অনুভূতি বা মতামত যতই অজানা থাকুক না কেন, এই সত্যটি আশেপাশের পরিবারগুলোর মনে এমনভাবে গেঁথে যায় যে, তাকে তাদের কন্যাদের মধ্যে একজনের উপযুক্ত স্বামী হিসেবে বিবেচনা করা হয়।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone effectively, with accurate rendering of the social commentary. Minor fluency issues arise from slightly awkward phrasing ('উপযুক্ত স্বামী হিসেবে বিবেচনা করা হয়' is somewhat verbose compared to the original's conciseness), and the opening irony could feel more natural in Bengali prose.

results.translated_text: স্টুডিওটি গোলাপের সুগন্ধ দিয়ে ভরে ছিল, আর হালকা গ্রীষ্মের বাতাস যখন বাগানের গাছগুলোর মধ্যে দিয়ে বয়ে যেত, তখন খোলা দরজা দিয়ে লিলি ফুলের তীব্র সুবাস অথবা হালকা গোলাপী রঙের ফুলের সুগন্ধ ভেসে আসত। তিনি পারস্যের নকশা করা রঙিন কুশনের উপর শুয়ে অগণিত সিগারেট খাচ্ছিলেন, সেই সময় লর্ড হেনরি ওটন তার অবস্থান থেকে ল্যাবার্নামের মধু-মিষ্টি এবং সোনালী রঙের ফুলগুলোর ঔজ্জ্বল্য দেখতে পান।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory details and meaning, but has notable issues: 'lilac' is mistranslated as 'lily' (লিলি), the sentence structure becomes awkward in the second half with unclear pronoun reference ('তিনি'), and the aesthetic precision of Wilde's prose is somewhat diluted. The poetic quality of 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' loses its rhythmic elegance in the Bengali rendering.

results.translated_text: “আমার মনে হচ্ছে আপনি আফগানিস্তানে ছিলেন।” আমি বিস্মিত হয়ে জিজ্ঞাসা করলাম, “আপনি এটা কীভাবে বুঝলেন?” তিনি মুচকি হেসে বললেন, “সেটা কোনো ব্যাপার না। আসল কথা হল হিমোগ্লোবিন। আপনি কি বুঝতে পারছেন যে আমার এই আবিষ্কার কতটা গুরুত্বপূর্ণ?” আমি উত্তর দিলাম, “রাসায়নিকভাবে এটা অবশ্যই интересное, তবে বাস্তবে এর কী প্রয়োগ—” তিনি বললেন, “আরে, এটা বছরের সেরা ব্যবহারিক চিকিৎসা ও আইনগত আবিষ্কার। আপনি কি বুঝতে পারছেন না যে এটা আমাদের রক্তের দাগ শনাক্ত করার জন্য একটি अचूक উপায়?”

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning but contains significant errors: two non-Bengali words (интересное in Russian and अचूक in Hindi) appear in the Bengali text, breaking fluency and accuracy. The dialogue structure is somewhat preserved but the natural flow and Sherlock Holmes's characteristic arrogance are diminished by awkward phrasing like 'সেটা কোনো ব্যাপার না' which feels too casual for the original's dismissive tone.

results.translated_text: আমি জঙ্গলে গিয়েছিলাম কারণ আমি ইচ্ছাকৃতভাবে জীবনযাপন করতে চেয়েছিলাম, জীবনের শুধুমাত্র প্রয়োজনীয় বিষয়গুলোর মুখোমুখি হতে চেয়েছিলাম, এবং জানতে চেয়েছিলাম যে এতে কোনো শিক্ষা আছে কিনা, এবং এমনও না হয় যে, যখন আমি মারা যাব, তখন আবিষ্কার করি যে আমি আসলে বাঁচিনি। আমি এমন জীবনযাপন করতে চাইনি, যা জীবনের মতো ছিল না; কারণ জীবন খুবই মূল্যবান। এবং আমি এমনভাবে resignation বা সবকিছু মেনে নেওয়ার অভ্যাস করতে চাইনি, যদি না তা একেবারে অপরিহার্য হয়। আমি গভীরভাবে বাঁচতে চেয়েছিলাম এবং জীবনের সমস্ত রস আস্বাদন করতে চেয়েছিলাম।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning but has notable issues: 'resignation' is left untranslated, the phrase 'living is so dear' is awkwardly rendered as a parenthetical explanation rather than flowing naturally, and some sentence structures feel clunky compared to the original's rhythmic eloquence. The philosophical depth is mostly preserved but the lyrical quality is diminished.

results.translated_text: আমাকে ইসমাইল ডাকো। কয়েক বছর আগে—ঠিক কত বছর, সেটা বড় একটা বিষয় নয়—আমার কাছে তেমন কোনো কাজ ছিল না, হাতেও তেমন টাকা ছিল না। তাই আমি ভাবলাম, একটু ঘুরে আসি এবং পৃথিবীর জলভাগটা দেখে আসি। এটা আমার খারাপ লাগা দূর করার এবং মনকে শান্ত রাখার একটা উপায়। যখনই আমার মুখটা কঠিন হয়ে যায়, অথবা যখনই আমার মনে বিষণ্ণ নভেম্বরের মতো অনুভূতি হয়, তখনই আমি মনে করি যে আমার দ্রুত সমুদ্রের দিকে যাওয়া উচিত।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and narrative voice reasonably well, but loses some of Melville's archaic formality and poetic nuance. Phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become more literal and less evocative, and the rhythmic cadence of the original prose is diminished in the Bengali rendering.

results.translated_text: நல்ல செல்வமுள்ள ஒரு ஆண், கண்டிப்பாக ஒரு மனைவியை வைத்திருக்க வேண்டும் என்பது உலகறிந்த உண்மை. அந்த மனிதனின் உணர்வுகள் அல்லது எண்ணங்கள் எவ்வளவு குறைவாக அறியப்பட்டிருந்தாலும், அவன் ஒரு புதிய இடத்திற்கு வரும்போது, அந்த உண்மை அந்த இடத்திலுள்ள மற்ற குடும்பங்களின் மனதில் ஆழமாக பதிந்திருக்கும். அதனால், அவன் அவர்களின் ஏதேனும் ஒரு மகளின் வாழ்க்கைத் துணை என்று கருதப்படுவான்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise effectively, though it slightly softens the original's biting social commentary by using 'வாழ்க்கைத் துணை' (life partner) instead of a more direct equivalent to 'property.' The Tamil flows naturally but lacks some of the original's sophisticated ironic tone and formal elegance.

results.translated_text: அந்த ஸ்டுடியோ ரோஜாக்களின் நறுமணத்தால் நிரம்பியிருந்தது. இலேசான கோடை காற்று தோட்டத்தில் இருந்த மரங்களுக்கு இடையே வீசும்போது, திறந்த கதவின் வழியே லிலாக் மலர்களின் அடர்த்தியான நறுமணமும், அல்லது இளஞ்சிவப்பு நிற பூக்களைக் கொண்ட முள்செடியின் மென்மையான நறுமணமும் வீசின. பாரசீக குதிரைப்படை போர்வைகளால் அலங்கரிக்கப்பட்ட திவானின் மூலையில், அவர் படுத்திருந்தபோது, வழக்கம்போல் எண்ணற்ற சிகரெட்டுகளை புகைத்துக் கொண்டிருந்தார். அங்கிருந்து லார்ட் ஹென்றி வாட்டன், தேன் நிறத்தில், தேன் போன்ற இனிமையான வாசனையுடன் கூடிய லேபர்னம் மலர்களின் அழகை அவ்வப்போது கண்டார்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory details and meaning accurately, but struggles with the flowing, lyrical quality of Wilde's prose. The sentence structure becomes fragmented and awkward in Tamil, particularly in the final sentence where the elegant observation is disrupted by awkward phrasing like 'அவ்வப்போது' (occasionally), which undermines the aesthetic intensity of the original.

results.translated_text: “நீங்கள் ஆப்கானிஸ்தானில் இருந்திருக்கிறீர்கள் என்று தெரிகிறது.” “எப்படி உங்களுக்கு அது தெரிந்தது?” என்று நான் ஆச்சரியத்துடன் கேட்டேன். “அதைப் பற்றி கவலைப்பட வேண்டாம்,” என்று அவர் கூறி, தனக்குத்தானே சிரித்துக் கொண்டார். “இப்போது கேள்வி ஹேமோகுளோபின் பற்றியது. என்னுடைய இந்த கண்டுபிடிப்பின் முக்கியத்துவத்தை நீங்கள் உணர்கிறீர்களா?” “இது வேதியியல் ரீதியாக சுவாரஸ்யமாக இருக்கிறது, ஆனால் நடைமுறையில்…” என்று நான் பதிலளித்தேன். “இல்லை, இது பல ஆண்டுகளாக மருத்துவ மற்றும் சட்டத் துறையில் மிகவும் பயனுள்ள கண்டுபிடிப்பு. இது இரத்தக்கறை உள்ள இடங்களை துல்லியமாகக் கண்டறிய உதவுகிறது அல்லவா?”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and dialogue structure, preserving Holmes's deductive confidence and Watson's astonishment. Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward phrasing in places (e.g., 'தனக்குத்தானே சிரித்துக் கொண்டார்' is somewhat verbose) and the style could better capture the Victorian-era formality and the sharp, rapid-fire nature of Holmes's speech patterns.

results.translated_text: நான் காடுகளுக்குச் சென்றேன், ஏனெனில் வேண்டுமென்றே வாழவும், வாழ்க்கையின் அத்தியாவசியமான உண்மைகளை மட்டும் எதிர்கொள்ளவும், அது என்ன சொல்ல விரும்புகிறதோ அதை கற்றுக்கொள்ளவும் விரும்பினேன். நான் இறக்கும்போது, நான் உண்மையில் வாழவில்லை என்று கண்டுபிடிக்க விரும்பவில்லை. வாழ்க்கையற்ற ஒன்றை வாழ விரும்பவில்லை, ஏனென்றால் வாழ்க்கை மிகவும் விலைமதிப்பற்றது; மேலும், அது முற்றிலும் அவசியமானதாக இல்லாவிட்டால், நான் விட்டுக்கொடுக்கும் வாழ்க்கையை வாழ விரும்பவில்லை. ஆழமாக வாழவும், வாழ்க்கையின் சாரத்தை முழுமையாக அனுபவிக்கவும் நான் விரும்பினேன்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core philosophical meaning and structure of Thoreau's passage reasonably well, but loses some of the lyrical intensity and poetic compression of the original. The phrase 'வாழ்க்கையின் சாரத்தை' (essence of life) adequately conveys 'marrow of life,' though with less visceral impact, and some sentences become slightly awkward in Tamil syntax, affecting the natural flow that characterizes Thoreau's deliberate, meditative prose style.

results.translated_text: என் பெயர் இஷ்மியேல். சில வருடங்களுக்கு முன்பு—எவ்வளவு காலம் என்று சரியாகச் சொல்ல முடியாது—என் பாக்கெட்டில் கொஞ்சம் கூட பணம் இல்லை. கரையோரத்தில் எனக்கு ஆர்வம் தரும் விஷயங்கள் எதுவும் இல்லை. அதனால், நான் கொஞ்சம் கடலில் பயணம் செய்து, உலகின் நீர் நிறைந்த பகுதியை சுற்றிப் பார்க்க முடிவு செய்தேன். இது, என் மனதிலுள்ள கவலைகளைப் போக்கவும், என் எண்ணங்களைச் சீராக்கவும் நான் பின்பற்றும் ஒரு வழி. நான் சோகமாகவோ அல்லது மன அழுத்தத்தில் இருக்கும்போது; என் மனதில் எப்போதும் மழை பெய்யும் நவம்பர் மாதத்தைப் போன்ற சூழ்நிலை நிலவும்போது, நான் உடனடியாகக் கடலுக்குச் செல்ல வேண்டிய நேரம் அது என்று உணர்கிறேன்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core narrative and philosophical meaning reasonably well, but loses the archaic literary elegance and introspective intimacy of Melville's prose. The metaphorical language (spleen, damp drizzly November) becomes more literal and explanatory rather than poetic, and the conversational intimacy of the original is diminished by more formal Tamil constructions.

results.translated_text: Всем известна истина, что одинокий мужчина, обладающий состоянием, непременно должен искать себе жену. И пусть чувства и взгляды этого мужчины не слишком известны при его первом появлении в каком-либо округе, эта истина настолько прочно укоренилась в сознании местных семей, что он считается законной собственностью одной из их дочерей.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone effectively, though 'Всем известна истина' loses some of the universal weight of 'universally acknowledged,' and 'законной собственностью' (lawful property) slightly softens the satirical edge of the original's 'rightful property.' The prose flows reasonably well but reads somewhat more formal than Austen's elegant irony.

results.translated_text: Студия была наполнена насыщенным ароматом роз, и когда легкий летний ветерок проносился сквозь деревья в саду, через открытую дверь доносился густой запах сирени или более нежный аромат цветущей розовой дикой розы. Лорд Генри Уоттон, лежа на диване, обитом персидскими коврами, и курящий, как обычно, бесчисленное количество сигарет, мог видеть из своего угла блеск медово-сладких и медово-желтых цветков золотарника.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general sensory richness but contains significant errors: 'saddle-bags' is mistranslated as 'carpets' (коврами), 'pink-flowering thorn' becomes 'wild rose' (дикой розы), and 'laburnum' is incorrectly rendered as 'goldenrod' (золотарника). The prose structure becomes awkward with the participial phrase, losing Wilde's flowing elegance and aesthetic precision.

results.translated_text: — Похоже, вы побывали в Афганистане, — заметил он. — Откуда вы узнали? — изумленно спросил я. — Неважно, — ответил он, усмехаясь. — Сейчас важнее другое: гемоглобин. Вы, должно быть, понимаете, какое значение имеет моё открытие? — С химической точки зрения это, безусловно, интересно, — ответил я, — но на практике… — Да что вы говорите! Это самое практичное открытие в области медицины и юриспруденции за последние годы. Разве вы не понимаете, что оно дает нам неопровержимый способ определения наличия пятен крови?

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and dialogue flow, with natural Russian phrasing that captures Holmes's intellectual excitement. Minor deviations include 'медицины и юриспруденции' (medicine and jurisprudence) being slightly more formal than the original 'medico-legal,' and some slight tonal shifts in exclamations, but these are minor and the overall character voice remains intact.

results.translated_text: Я отправился в лес, потому что хотел жить осознанно, столкнуться лицом к лицу лишь с самыми важными аспектами жизни и посмотреть, не смогу ли я извлечь уроки из этого опыта, чтобы, когда придёт моя пора умирать, не обнаружить, что я прожил жизнь впустую. Я не хотел жить жизнью, которой жизнь назвать нельзя, ведь жизнь так драгоценна; да и смиряться с неизбежным я не хотел, если в этом не было крайней необходимости. Я хотел жить полной жизнью и выжать из неё всё до последней капли.

scores.feedback: The translation captures Thoreau's philosophical intent and most key meanings accurately, with strong rendering of the famous passage's core message about deliberate living. Minor issues include 'извлечь уроки из этого опыта' (extract lessons from experience) being slightly more explanatory than the original's 'learn what it had to teach,' and 'выжать из неё всё до последней капли' (squeeze out every last drop) being somewhat more colloquial than Thoreau's 'suck out all the marrow'—though both c

results.translated_text: Зовите меня Измаил. Лет несколько тому назад – неважно, сколько именно – когда в моей копилке почти не осталось денег, и на суше меня ничто особенно не занимало, я решил немного попутешествовать по морям и взглянуть на водную часть света. Это мой способ развеять хандру и привести в норму кровообращение. Каждый раз, когда я замечаю, что у меня мрачнеет лицо; каждый раз, когда в моей душе наступает сырая, дождливая ноябрьская пора, я считаю, что пора как можно скорее отправиться в плавание.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and philosophical tone of Melville's opening, with good preservation of the metaphorical language about melancholy and the sea. However, some archaic English nuances are softened ("growing grim about the mouth" becomes "мрачнеет лицо" which is less vivid), and the rhythm feels slightly more modern Russian than the deliberately archaic English original.

results.translated_text: Загальновідомий факт, що чоловік, який має статки, обов’язково має потребу в дружині. Хоч би як мало ми знали про почуття чи погляди такого чоловіка, коли він вперше з’являється в якомусь містечку, ця істина настільки міцно вкорінилася в свідомості місцевих родин, що його вважають законною власністю однієї з їхніх дочок.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone effectively, though it loses some of Austen's formal elegance and the opening's philosophical weight by rendering 'It is a truth universally acknowledged' more literally as 'Загальновідомий факт' rather than preserving the declarative grandeur. The irony remains intact but reads slightly more straightforward than the original.

results.translated_text: Студію наповнював насичений аромат троянд, і коли легкий літній вітерець здіймався серед дерев у саду, крізь відчинені двері долинав важкий запах бузку або ніжніший аромат рожевих квітів глоду. З кута дивана, оббитого перськими килимовими подушками, на якому він лежав і, як зазвичай, палив незліченну кількість цигарок, лорд Генрі Воттон міг розгледіти мерехтіння медово-солодких і медово-жовтих квітів золотарника.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness and meaning accurately, though 'золотарника' (goldenrod) is an incorrect identification of 'laburnum' (акація золотистої або ланцетника), which affects botanical accuracy. The prose flows naturally in Ukrainian but loses some of the aesthetic delicacy through slightly more literal phrasing compared to Wilde's ornate, flowing style.

results.translated_text: — Ви, очевидно, побували в Афганістані, — сказав він. — Звідки ви це знаєте? — здивовано запитав я. — Неважливо, — відповів він, усміхаючись. — Зараз важливіше обговорити гемоглобін. Без сумніву, ви розумієте, яке значення має моє відкриття? — З хімічної точки зору це, безумовно, цікаво, — відповів я, — але на практиці… — Та ні, це найпрактичніше медико-юридичне відкриття за останні роки. Хіба ви не бачите, що воно дає нам надійний метод для виявлення плям крові?

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning and dialogue structure well, with accurate rendering of the scientific discussion and character interaction. However, minor fluency issues exist: 'Звідки ви це знаєте?' is slightly awkward (better as 'Як ви це дізналися?'), and some phrasing feels slightly stiff compared to natural Ukrainian dialogue, particularly in the closing exchange.

results.translated_text: Я пішов у ліс, бо хотів жити свідомо, зустрічатися лише з найважливішими фактами життя і спробувати зрозуміти, чому воно мене може навчити, щоб, коли прийде час помирати, не виявилося, що я так і не жив. Я не хотів жити не справжнім життям, адже життя таке цінне; і не хотів вдаватися до смирення, якщо тільки це не було абсолютно необхідно. Я хотів жити повноцінно і вичавлювати всі соки з життя.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical essence and meaning of Thoreau's text with strong fidelity, though minor semantic shifts occur (e.g., 'чому воно мене може навчити' adds 'why' not in original, 'вичавлювати' is slightly less poetic than 'suck out'). The Ukrainian reads naturally and preserves the deliberate, introspective tone, though some of the original's rhythmic intensity and paradoxical weight are slightly diminished in the target language.

results.translated_text: Звіть мене Ізмаїл. Якось, років тому – вже й не пам’ятаю, скільки саме – коли в моїй кишені майже не було грошей, і на суші не було нічого, що могло б мене зацікавити, я вирішив трохи поплавати й подивитися на водні простори цього світу. Це мій спосіб позбутися нудьги та налагодити кровообіг. Щоразу, коли я помічаю, що мої губи починають кривитися в гримасі; щоразу, коли в моїй душі настає сірий, дощовий листопад, я розумію, що настав час якнайшвидше вийти в море.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately, though 'Звіть мене' is awkward (should be 'Назвіть мене' or 'Зовіть мене'), and some metaphorical nuances are lost or altered. The fluency suffers from occasionally stiff phrasing and the archaic style, while strong in places, doesn't fully match Melville's contemplative, conversational tone—particularly in how the existential musings are rendered.

results.translated_text: إنها حقيقة مُسلم بها عالميًا، وهي أن الرجل الأعزب الذي يمتلك ثروة كبيرة، لا بد وأن يكون بحاجة إلى زوجة. وعلى الرغم من أن مشاعر وآراء هذا الرجل قد تكون غير معروفة عند وصوله إلى حي جديد، إلا أن هذه الحقيقة راسخة في أذهان العائلات المحيطة، لدرجة أنهم يعتبرونه ملكًا محتملاً لإحدى بناتهم.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and ironic tone of Austen's opening, with natural Arabic phrasing that reads well. Minor stylistic adjustments (e.g., 'ملكًا محتملاً' for 'property' is slightly softer than the original's satirical edge) prevent a perfect score, but overall this is a strong, faithful rendering.

results.translated_text: امتلأ الاستوديو برائحة الورد الفواحة، وعندما هبّت نسمة الصيف الخفيفة بين أشجار الحديقة، تسربت من الباب المفتوح رائحة الياسمين العطرة، أو العطر الأكثر رقة لأزهار النرجس. من زاوية الأريكة المصنوعة من أقمشة السرج الفارسية التي كان يرقد عليها، وهو يدخن كما جرت عادته، عددًا لا يحصى من السجائر، كان بإمكان اللورد هنري وتون أن يلمح بريق أزهار اللوبينيوم ذات اللون الذهبي والعسلي.

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant errors: 'lilac' is incorrectly rendered as 'jasmine' (الياسمين) and 'pink-flowering thorn' becomes 'narcissus' (النرجس), fundamentally altering Wilde's sensory palette. While some aesthetic elements are preserved, the awkward sentence structure and loss of the original's flowing musicality diminish both fluency and style fidelity.

results.translated_text: "يبدو أنك قضيت بعض الوقت في أفغانستان". "كيف عرفت ذلك؟" سألتُ في دهشة. "لا يهم"، قال وهو يضحك. "المسألة الآن تتعلق بالهيموجلوبين. لا شك أنك تدرك أهمية هذا الاكتشاف الذي توصلت إليه؟" "إنه اكتشاف مثير للاهتمام من الناحية الكيميائية، بلا شك"، أجبت، "ولكن من الناحية العملية—" "يا رجل، إنه أهم اكتشاف طبي قانوني عملي على الإطلاق في السنوات الأخيرة. ألا ترى أنه يمنحنا اختبارًا لا يُخطئ لتحديد وجود بقع الدم؟"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the logical flow of the deductive dialogue. Minor stylistic adjustments (such as "يا رجل" for "man" and slight variations in emphasis) create minor deviations from the original Victorian tone, but the overall quality is strong with natural Arabic phrasing.

results.translated_text: ذهبت إلى الغابة لأنني أردت أن أعيش حياة واعية، وأن أواجه الحقائق الأساسية للحياة فحسب، وأن أرى ما إذا كان بإمكاني أن أتعلم ما يمكن أن تعلمني إياه، وألا أكتشف، عندما يحين موعد موتي، أنني لم أكن قد عشت حقًا. لم أكن أريد أن أعيش حياة لا تستحق أن تُعاش، فالعيش شيء ثمين؛ ولم أكن أرغب في ممارسة الاستسلام، إلا إذا كان ذلك ضروريًا للغاية. أردت أن أعيش بعمق وأن أستخلص كل خير من الحياة.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures Thoreau's philosophical meaning and existential concerns with only minor semantic shifts (e.g., 'استخلص كل خير' is slightly softer than 'suck out all the marrow'). The Arabic flows naturally and maintains the contemplative tone, though some of the raw intensity and metaphorical precision of the original is slightly diminished in the final phrase.

results.translated_text: نادوني بإسمعيل. قبل بضع سنوات—لا يهم تحديدًا كم—وبحيث لم يكن لدي الكثير من المال، ولا شيء يثير اهتمامي على اليابسة، فكرت في أن أبحر قليلًا وأستكشف الأجزاء المائية من العالم. إنها طريقة أتبعها للتخلص من الملل وتنظيم الدورة الدموية. كلما شعرت أنني أصبح متجهّم الوجه؛ وكلما كان هناك شعور كئيب ورطب يسيطر عليّ، أعتبر أن الوقت قد حان للتوجه إلى البحر في أقرب وقت ممكن.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning and narrative voice but loses some nuance in Melville's philosophical tone and idiomatic expressions. The archaic, contemplative style is diminished, and phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become more literal and less evocative in Arabic, affecting the literary elegance of the original.

results.translated_text: אמת ידועה היא, שגבר רווק בעל הון, חייב להיות זקוק לאישה. יהיו אשר יהיו רגשותיו או דעותיו של גבר זה, ברגע שהוא מגיע לשכונה חדשה, האמת הזו מושרשת כל כך בתודעת המשפחות בסביבה, עד שהוא נתפס כרכוש הראוי לאחת מבנותיהן.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone effectively, though the opening phrase 'אמת ידועה היא' (truth known is) is slightly awkward compared to the more natural 'זו אמת ידועה' (this is a known truth). The rendering of Austen's characteristic irony is mostly preserved, but some of the original's rhythmic elegance is lost in the Hebrew phrasing.

results.translated_text: הסטודיו היה מלא בניחוח עז של ורדים, וכאשר משב רוח קל של הקיץ עבר בין עצי הגינה, נישא דרך הדלת הפתוחה הריח הכבד של לילך, או הניחוח העדין יותר של פרחי הבר השושן. מפינת הספה, עשויה שקי בד פרסיים עליהם הוא שכב, מעשן כהרגלו, מספר עצום של סיגריות, יכול היה הלורד הנרי ווטון לראות את הברק של הפרחים המתוקים כמו דבש ובעלי הגוון הזהוב של הצטברות (Laburnum).

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning and sensory details but has structural awkwardness, particularly in the middle section where the syntax becomes convoluted ('מפינת הספה...יכול היה'). While the aesthetic vocabulary is generally preserved, the lyrical flow and elegance of Wilde's prose are diminished, and the phrase about laburnum feels clunky with the transliteration in parentheses rather than a natural Hebrew equivalent.

results.translated_text: "נראה שביקרת באפגניסטן", אמרתי. "מאיפה לעזאזל אתה יודע את זה?" שאלתי בתדהמה. "לא משנה", אמר, וצחק לעצמו. "השאלה עכשיו היא לגבי המוגלובין. אין ספק שאתה מבין את חשיבות התגלית שלי, נכון?" "זה מעניין, אין ספק, מבחינה כימית", עניתי, "אבל מבחינה מעשית –" "מה, בחור, זוהי התגלית הרפואית-משפטית המעשית ביותר שנראתה כאן כבר שנים. האם אתה לא מבין שזה נותן לנו בדיקה אמינה לחלוטין לזיהוי כתמי דם?"

scores.feedback: The translation has significant structural and attribution errors—the opening line is incorrectly attributed to the narrator instead of Holmes, disrupting the dialogue flow and character dynamics. While most vocabulary is accurate, the Hebrew phrasing is often awkward and unnatural, with phrases like 'מאיפה לעזאזל' and 'שנראתה כאן כבר שנים' that don't match the original's elegance and clarity.

results.translated_text: נכנסתי ליער כי רציתי לחיות בצורה מודעת, להתמודד רק עם העובדות החיוניות של החיים, ולראות אם אוכל ללמוד מהם, ולא, כאשר יגיע זמני למות, לגלות שמעולם לא חייתי באמת. לא רציתי לחיות חיים שאינם חיים, כי החיים יקרים מכל; ולא רציתי לתרגל ויתור, אלא אם כן זה יהיה הכרחי לחלוטין. רציתי לחיות בעוצמה ולשאוב את כל תמצית החיים.

scores.feedback: The translation captures Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent well, with faithful rendering of key concepts like deliberate living and extracting life's essence. However, some phrasings feel slightly more formal or awkward than the original's natural cadence, and minor nuances like the existential weight of 'not lived' are somewhat diluted by 'לא חייתי באמת' (not truly lived).

results.translated_text: קוראים לי ישמעאל. לפני כמה שנים – לא משנה בדיוק כמה – כשלא היה לי כסף בכיס ושום דבר מיוחד שמעניין אותי ביבשה, חשבתי שאצא להפלגה קצרה ואראה את החלק המיימי של העולם. זו דרך שלי להרגיע את עצמי ולשפר את מצב הרוח. בכל פעם שאני מרגיש שהשפתיים שלי מתחילות להתעוות; בכל פעם שנובמבר רטוב ומעורפל משתרר בנשמתי, אני מבין שהגיע הזמן לצאת לים בהקדם האפשרי.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and philosophical tone of Melville's opening, though some nuances are lost—'driving off the spleen' becomes 'calming myself' (less idiomatic), and 'growing grim about the mouth' shifts to 'lips beginning to distort' (missing the metaphorical weight). The archaic literary style is partially preserved but feels somewhat modernized in places, particularly in the psychological descriptions.
